title: Hub Manager / Team Lead - Stockholm
description:
**About Justera Group**  

Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.  

  

**About the Role:**  

We are seeking a committed and structured Hub Manager / Team Lead for a one-year parental leave assignment within a digital and customer experience–driven organization in the energy sector. In this role, you will be part of the CX and Digital Channels department, which is responsible for customer insights, digital channel development, and the creation of seamless digital services and customer journeys. You will lead one of the department’s agile development teams, consisting of developers, UX designers, quality assurance specialists, and a Scrum Master. The role includes responsibility for budgeting, governance, security, and delivery in close collaboration with product owners. While you will guide and coach the team in their daily work, you will not hold formal personnel responsibility.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Manage budget, resource planning, and allocation for the team
* Develop and drive governance processes, ensuring compliance and security
* Provide coaching and daily support to team members
* Act as a key link between IT, CX design, Architecture, Communications, and other departments
* Follow up on goals, results, and continuously improve ways of working
* Manage and negotiate new and existing agreements
* Participate in leadership forums with other team leads within the department
* Ensure alignment with organizational guidelines, processes, and standards, and contribute to ongoing improvements
* 

**Requirements:**

* Experience in similar leadership roles, such as Engineering Manager, Project Manager, or Team Lead
* Scrum Master experience is highly advantageous
* Strong ability to work cross-functionally with understanding of technology, users, and business needs
* Confident in handling budget, governance, and security responsibilities
* Natural coaching abilities that foster team growth and collective delivery
* Fluent communication skills in both Swedish and English
* Experience as a Scrum Master or Engineering Manager
* Previous experience in digital product development or agile organizations
* 

**What We Offer:**

  

* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: UX:are
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Har dokumenterad senior kompetens och erfarenhet inom användbarhet
* Har dokumenterad senior kompetens och erfarenhet inom interaktionsdesign
* Har dokumenterad kompetens och erfarenhet inom gränssnittsdesign
* Har förmåga att pedagogiskt strukturera information för att uppnå bästa användbarhet för användare
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla designsystem

  

**Meriterande**  

* Kompetens och erfarenhet inom användartester

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 05-12-2025 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Tech Lead
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

Teknik: Java (Spring Boot), REST API-utveckling, microservices, Kafka, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, React med typescript, back-end for front-end (BFF), förståelse för UX och UI  

  

Erfarenhet av att modellera API-kontrakt och JSON-strukturer  

Test: Automatiserad testning (JUnit, integrationstester)  

Miljö: Vana att arbeta i on-prem miljöer med cloud-agnostisk strategi  

Erfarenhet och vana att arbeta enligt agilt arbetssätt  

  

**Meriterande**  

Erfarenhet av masterdatahantering och eventdriven arkitektur, filkommunikation och integrationer, front-end utveckling och UX.  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 10-12-2025

 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Product Manager
description:
*Kreditz is transforming how businesses assess credit and risk using real-time data and NextGen Credit Scoring solutions.*

*As one of Europe’s fastest-growing FinTech scaleups - we’ve earned a place on the* ***Sifted 100: Nordics & Benelux*** *list in both 2024 and 2025 and most recently, we were proud to receive a* ***double win at the Credit Management & Compliance Awards 2025****, being named both "****Fintech Rocket of the Year****" and "****Breakthrough of the Year****".*

 *With strong growth across the Nordics and Europe, our clients range from leading banks and iGaming giants to fast-moving digital innovators.*

*Now, we’re looking for a* ***Product Manager*** *who can help transform a high-performing fintech into a billion-dollar business.*

**ABOUT THE POSITION**


As Product Manager at Kreditz, you will take ownership of one of our core product areas and drive the roadmap from vision to execution. You will play a crucial role in shaping next generation of our credit and risk solutions - ensuring that our products deliver exceptional value, scalability, and a world-class user experience.


This is a hands-on role for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. You will collaborate closely with Tech, AI, Commercial, Legal, and Customer Success to bring new features to life, refine existing products, and ensure we are solving real customer problems at scale.


You don’t need a technical degree - but you **must** feel comfortable working closely with technical teams, understanding complexity, and translating it into clear decisions, priorities, and outcomes.

 **WHAT CAN KREDITZ OFFER**

  

* A once-in-a-lifetime growth journey, from startup to Global scaleup  

	+ A journey where *everyone* in the team plays a crucial role for our company’s success
* The opportunity to build products that become the backbone of Next-generation financial decisioning in Europe
* Fun-loving, driven, and passionate colleagues who support each other’s success  

	+ Work alongside word class AI and Data Science teams
* A culture that celebrates progress, humility, and teamwork  

	+ We win *together*
* 24/7 access to gym, sauna and sports facilities at our office, plus additional wellness allowance
* Competitive base salary

**RESPONSIBILITES**


Some of the main responsibilities you will cover:

* Own and define the product roadmap for your product area, ensuring  

alignment with company strategy
* Scope complex projects and develop workplan
* Translate customer needs, market insights, and business requirements into clear product priorities
* Lead cross-functional collaboration with engineering, data, design, compliance, and commercial teams
* Drive product development execution end-to-end, from concept and specifications to rollout, adoption, and improvement iterations
* Analyze data and customer behaviour to inform decisions and measureproduct impact
* Work closely with clients and stakeholders to understand pain points, validate hypotheses, and refine solutions
* Champion a product mindset within the organization and foster alignment around product vision and goals
* Contribute to building scalable processes, documentation, and feedback loops as we transition from startup to scaleup
* Assess existing products and leverage teams to improve impact and enhance UX continuously

**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**


We believe that you have:

  

* 3+ years experience working as a Product Manager (or equivalent role) in a tech-driven company
* Experience from a **s****tartup-to-scaleup journey** - knowing how to build structure without slowing down speed
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, in **English & Swedish** (verbal and written)
* Strong ability to turn complex technical capabilities into simple, impactful  

product experiences
* A data-driven mindset with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* A structured yet pragmatic approach to prioritization, decision-making, and execution
* Experience collaborating closely with Tech, data, commercial and AI  

teams
* Genuine interest and curiosity to learn new things on the fly
* Previous experience in Management Consulting *is desirable*
* A passion for fintech, risk, credit, or financial infrastructure *is meritorious*
* Experience with Open Banking/PSD2 or financial APIs i*s meritorious*
* Knowledge of analytics and/or software development concepts *is*  

*meritorious*

  

**WHY JOIN NOW?**


With continued growth, and profitability on the horizon, strong investor backing, and a growing client base across Europe, we are entering our most exciting phase yet.


This is a rare opportunity to:

  

* Build the financial backbone of one of Europe’s next fintech success stories
* Shape the future of how businesses assess credit and risk
* Have a direct impact on the product direction and the company’s long-term trajectory


If you want to be part of a team where ambition, innovation, and collaboration drive everything we do - **we’d love to meet you.**

 **APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**


Starting date Q1 2026

**SCOPE**


Full-time, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)

**SALARY**


Competitive salary

**REPORTING**


You will be reporting to the company’s CPO

**WORKPLACE**


Danderyd, Stockholm

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**


Ongoing selection, we review candidates continuously.  

*Last day for applications 9/1-2026*

**CRIMINAL RECORDS EXTRACT**


As part of our recruitment process we will ask you to present a clean criminal records extract

 **CONTACT**


Lorenzo Puccio, VP Strategic Operations, Lorenzo@kreditz.com


For more information about the role feel free to reach out to our CPO, Spilios Tzouras, spilios.tzouras@kreditz.com

title: Digital analytiker
description:
Hos oss på Knowit Experience kommer du att vara en viktig del i ett team av analytiker som jobbar tillsammans med att göra våra kunder, stora som små, mer datadrivna i sina beslut. Vi strävar efter att skapa affärsnytta och effekt för våra kunder.


I rollen som analytiker kommer du att arbeta operativt i nära samarbete med våra kunder gällande digital analys. Utöver kundprojekt förväntas du även att vara med och bryta ny mark, utveckla och expandera våra affärer


I samarbete med våra inspirerande och kreativa kollegor inom bland annat projektledning, tech, QA, UX och design kommer du arbeta med vitt skilda projekt där du ansvarar för att skapa och upprätthålla mätningar, analysera och presentera data för kunden samt driva tester för konverteringsoptimering.

 **Vi söker dig som...**

  

Har erfarenhet av verktyg som:

* Google Analytics
* Tag Manager
* Looker Studio
* BigQuery / Google Cloud Platform
* SQL
* JavaScript
* CMPs (Så som: Cookiebot, Cookie Information etc.)
* SEO


Bonus om du har erfarenhet av:

  

* AEO / GEO
* Något statistiskt programmeringsspråk som R eller Python.
* Piwik Pro
* PowerBI och Microsoft Fabric
* Matomo
* Microsoft Clarity


Andra analysrelaterade verktyg är det meriterande, men huvudsaken är att du har ett brinnande intresse för det du gör och alltid strävar efter att förbättra dig.


Du är van vid att använda AI som ett stöd i ditt dagliga analysarbete. För rollen är det en fördel om du både förstår hur AI-drivna verktyg kan effektivisera processen och hur du kan omsätta insikterna till konkreta rekommendationer som driver trafik och resultat.


Då merparten av våra kunder är svenskspråkiga är ett krav att du talar och skriver på svenska och engelska obehindrat.


**Vad kan du förvänta dig och vilka är vi?**  

Vi är affärsområdet Experience inom Knowit-koncernen och vi hjälper våra kunder genom att leverera specialistkompetens i hela kundresan; från strategi och koncept till design, analys och utveckling av webb och e-handel. Vi arbetar brett över flera branscher, bland annat besöksnäring, turism, retail, bank, medtech, vård och industri. Våra kunder finns inom både privat och offentlig sektor.


Vi bär på stor passion och entusiasm för skapa värdefulla digitala upplevelser och lösningar. Vi både stöttar, uppmuntrar och lär av varandra dagligen. Vi är ett bolag som alltid strävar efter att bli bättre, och det blir vi genom att värdesätta initiativ och ge varje medarbetare chans till att växa hos oss. Något som är lika viktigt för oss är att du som medarbetare har möjlighet att kombinera arbete och fritid, allt för en bra balans i vardagen.


Hos oss blir du en del av ett engagerat och tvärfunktionellt team, där din närmaste chef stöttar dig både i din vardag och i din utveckling. Samtidigt har du tillgång till ett dedikerat nätverk av kollegor inom samma kompetensområde, som bidrar med erfarenhetsutbyte, inspiration och stöd.


Du erbjuds en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal, generösa och proaktiva hälso- och friskvårdsupplägg samt pensions- och försäkringsförmåner. Vi jobbar hårt med jämställdhet, miljö och hållbarhet och vi är stolta och glada över att ha blivit utnämnda till det mest jämställda börsnoterade bolaget.

 **Anställning/Tillträde**  

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering i Göteborg. Omfattningen är på heltid med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Vi sitter i nybyggda Platinan som förutom kontor erbjuder gym, restauranger, takterrass och en skybar med utsikt över älven och hamninloppet. Vi älskar att ses och inspireras av varandra men självklart har vi en flexibel hybridvardag. Ditt arbete kan utföras i en kombination av vårt kontor, kunders kontor och hemifrån, beroende på vad som passar dig och uppdraget bäst. Varmt välkommen att söka tjänsten redan idag!

**Kontaktperson**  

Frågor? Tveka inte att höra av dig till Caroline Almqvist, caroline.almqvist@knowit.se

**Hur är det att jobba hos oss?**  

Kika in på vår Instagram för att få en inblick i vår vardag.

title: Senior SEO Manager
description:
Brinner du för SEO, datadriven utveckling och att skapa resultat i toppklass? Vill du leda ett kompetent team och samtidigt ha ett helhetsansvar för kundens digitala synlighet? Då kan du vara den **Senior SEO Manager** vi söker till Robin.

### **Om rollen**


Som Senior SEO Manager hos Robin får du en central och strategisk roll där du leder och utvecklar vårt SEO-team. Du säkerställer att våra kunder får högsta kvalitet i sin sökoptimering, sina webbstrukturer och sina innehållsleveranser.


Rollen kombinerar ledarskap, teknisk expertis och en djup förståelse för hur SEO, innehåll, teknik och modern sökteknik samspelar för att skapa affärsnytta. Du kan också gå in operativt när det behövs, bland annat i tekniska analyser, keyword research eller i att stötta webbproduktionsteamet med din kompetens.

### **Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**

* Leda, coacha och utveckla SEO-teamet
* Säkerställa kvalitet och struktur i alla kundprojekt
* Utföra och kvalitetssäkra tekniska SEO-analyser och identifiera förbättringsområden
* Stötta webbproduktionsteamet med SEO-perspektiv i webbstruktur, teknik och innehåll
* Arbeta hands-on i CMS som WordPress, Squarespace, WooCommerce, Shopify och andra plattformar
* Säkerställa korrekt spårning, datainsamling och cookie consent-hantering
* Analysera och presentera resultat i GA4 och andra verktyg
* Genomföra keyword research, konkurrentanalys och identifiera nya möjligheter genom data och sökbeteenden
* Hitta sökvolymer, sökmöjligheter och kreativa keyword-vinklar som skapar trafik och affärsvärde
* Säkerställa att arbetssätt och leveranser anpassas till utvecklingen inom SEO, AI-driven sökning och GEO-signaler
* Omsätta branschtrender till förbättrade processer, verktyg och arbetsmetoder

### **Vi söker dig som har**

* 5+ års erfarenhet av SEO-arbete
* Erfarenhet av att leda team eller driva SEO-projekt
* Stark kompetens inom teknisk SEO
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av keyword research och datadriven innehållsstrategi
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och optimera webbplatser i moderna CMS
* Van att arbeta med SEO-drivet innehåll och förstå hur content, teknik och UX samspelar
* Mycket god erfarenhet av GA4, tracking, attribuering och datadrivna beslut
* God förståelse för domäner, hosting, serverteknik och hur detta påverkar SEO och webbprestanda

#### **Meriterande:**

* Tekniska kunskaper som PHP, JavaScript, SQL eller frontend
* Erfarenhet av länkstrategier och uppbyggnad av auktoritet
* Att du har drivit egna webbplatser eller digitala projekt

### **Vi tror att du är**

* En inspirerande ledare som gillar att utveckla SEO-specialister
* Kreativ och analytisk, med förmåga att hitta sökordsmöjligheter även där andra inte ser dem
* Strukturerad, datadriven och van att prioritera i många parallella projekt
* Teknisk men också affärsmedveten

### **Vi erbjuder**

  

Det här är en nyckelroll i ett väletablerat och snabbt växande digitalt bolag, där du får möjlighet att forma framtidens SEO-arbete på Robin. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team med en kultur som uppmuntrar initiativ, innovation och utveckling, samtidigt som du erbjuds flexibla arbetsformer och attraktiva förmåner.  

  

Var med och utveckla ett av Nordens största digitala bolag. Skicka in din ansökan redan idag, vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.  

  

Vid frågor om rollen, vänligen kontakta Sofia Eriksson, Nordic Manager of Customer Success, på sofia.eriksson@teamrobin.com

title: Product Director
description:
**Låt oss bygga framtida generationer**
=======================================

"Future generations that not only believe they can change the world, but equipped with a practical foundation so they can "


Idag kopplar vi samman hushåll som behöver hjälp med ungdomar i deras närområde genom vår app. De vanligaste tjänsterna våra Yeps (våra “Young Entrepreneurs”) utför är barnpassning och trädgårdsarbete. Faktum är att Yepstr-gruppen är störst i Sverige på just barnpassning.


Under de senaste åren har vi finslipat och förfinat vår affärsmodell, gjort våra kunder nöjda och gett tiotusentals unga riktiga jobb. Nu satsar vi ännu hårdare på produktdriven tillväxt – och söker en **Product Director** som ska leda vägen.

**Rollen i korthet**
--------------------

Som vår Product Director äger du vår produkt – från vision till tillväxt och vinst.


Du kommer att:

* Äga, forma och driva en tydlig, inspirerande produktvision som leder till mätbara affärsresultat tillsammans med ditt produktteam
* Leda vårt multidisciplinära produktteam (1 designer, 3 utvecklare och 2 Customer Success/Support), och coacha teamet att iterera snabbt med fokus på lärande och verklig impact
* Arbeta nära vår Chief Growth Officer för att säkerställa att produkt och tillväxt är tätt integrerade

**Vad du faktiskt kommer att göra**
-----------------------------------

#### **Leda discovery på Yepstr**


Prata med användare, analysera data (via Mixpanel), genomföra experiment och syntetisera insikter till tydliga produktmöjligheter. Utvärdera implementerade features mot din hypotes (e.g. "den borde förbättra conversion 5%!") för att maximera lärande

#### **Driva Roadmap med impact**


Vad ska vi bygga härnäst – och varför? Planera och prioritera strategiskt utifrån vår north star, OKRs, tillgängliga resurser, säsongsvariation, growth-initiativ med mera.

#### **Leda produktteamet mot effektivitet**


Ge teamet superkrafter genom att tillåta sekventiellt laser-fokus. Du är hands-on och levererar feedback på design, copy och teknisk implementation för att garantera hög hastighet och kvalitet i leveransen av smidiga, intuitiva flöden.

#### **Skapa och utnyttja feedback-loopar**


Se till att vi ständigt lär oss från användare, ditt support-team, data, hypotestester och experiment. Du blir personen i teamet som känner våra användare bäst. Supportvolymen är låg, men insikterna är höga. Du säkerställer att vi fångar upp och agerar på detta systematiskt.

**Vem vi tror att du är**
-------------------------

Du känner troligen igen dig i de flesta punkter – du är den drivna, analytiska ledaren som älskar att bygga!

* Du har lett produktteam tidigare (PM / Product Lead / Head of Product / liknande)
* Du har en bakgrund för (eller en passion inom) det kommersiella, affärssidan, marknadsföring eller liknande och motiveras av siffror och experiment
* Du är strategisk och har suttit i lednings- eller managementgrupp tidigare. Du har förmåga att översätta vision till effektiva OKRs.
* Du är en Doer och får saker att hända – du är snabb, driven och kliver in där det behövs. Vi söker en person som leder genom action och driver en hög exekveringstakt i teamet.
* Du pratar flytande svenska (ett måste för att plocka upp de viktiga nyanserna när du talar med våra användare) och du värdesätter att jobba tillsammans IRL från vårt kontor i Stockholm

**Meriterande (men inte krav)**
-------------------------------

* Erfarenhet av konsumentappar – hjälper dig få en snabb start
* Erfarenhet av digitala marknadsplatser – förståelse för utbud/efterfrågan och cold-start-problem
* Designkunskap – så du kan ge konkret feedback på design direkt
* UX-copywriting – för att förbättra microcopy och flöden snabbt, utan att vänta in andra

**Vad vi erbjuder**
-------------------

* En spännande tid att komma in – kassaflödespositivitet och stabil tillväxt, med stora ambitioner framåt
* Verkligt ägandeskap över produkten – du sätter riktningen, bygger teamet och våra arbetssätt
* Entreprenöriell miljö – en chans att verkligen göra Yepstr “till ditt”
* Högpresterande kultur – kombinerat med stort förtroende och frihet
* Konkurrenskraftig lön – plus möjlighet till ägande genom optioner
* Kontor i Stockholm – vi jobbar tillsammans IRL

**Hör det direkt från källan**
------------------------------

Här är en poddintervju med vår grundare Jacob – de första 15 minuterna sammanfattar det hela rätt bra:


https://www.dropbox.com/s/vzfmczz0hxv5l90/Whatsinthewater.mp3?dl=0


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!


**Jacob & Team Yepstr**

title: Local Product Lead
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to be your trusted financial partner. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 450+ amazing people who work here.**

**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**

**We are now looking for a Local Product Lead, Sweden.**


As a Local Product Lead, you are the vital link between our central product organization and the local market team - translating global strategy into local success. In this hybrid role, you combine strategic thinking with a hands-on approach: configuring, testing, and optimizing our product to meet local customer needs and business goals.


You thrive in the intersection of data, experimentation, and execution - ensuring that our global vision truly resonates in the local market. Your work will be key to maintaining product-market fit, driving measurable growth, and shaping future product improvements through local insights and performance data.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**

  

* Serve as the main connection between local and central product teams, ensuring smooth implementation of new features, configurations, and rollouts.
* Adapt global initiatives to local needs, conducting testing and QA to maintain high standards of quality and performance.
* Design, run, and analyze experiments (e.g. A/B tests) to improve customer journeys and conversion metrics.
* Track and optimize local KPIs, collaborating closely with analytics and UX to translate insights into tangible improvements.
* Bring local market perspectives and data-driven recommendations to central product discussions, identifying emerging opportunities and trends.
* Partner cross-functionally with commercial, tech, and design teams to drive initiatives from idea to impact.
* Foster a culture of experimentation, hands-on learning, and continuous optimization within the local product team.
  

  

**Qualifications**

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
* 4+ years of experience in a product management, product operations, or growth/experimentation role.
* Proven ability to balance strategic insight with hands-on execution.
* Strong analytical and quantitative skills; experience with A/B testing, experimentation tools, and performance tracking.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Experience in fintech, SaaS, or digital consumer products is a plus.  
* **You’ll Thrive in This Role If You…**
* Enjoy blending strategy with hands-on product work.
* Are passionate about localizing and optimizing global products for real customer impact.
* Have a data-driven mindset and a bias for experimentation.
* Can operate effectively between global and local teams – translating strategy into results.
  
* 

  

**What we offer:**

* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.

A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.  
* **Please note:**
  

The position will remain open for applications until late December, after which we will begin the selection process and start interviews in January

title: UX designer
description:
**A****bout us at HomeQ:** As Sweden's largest marketplace for first-hand residential rentals, HomeQ stands at the forefront of bringing together home seekers and real estate companies. We're a fast-growing scale-up company acquired in early 2024 by the leading marketplace operator in the Nordics, Vend (previously Schibsted).  

  

**Team Dynamics & Workstyle**: At HomeQ, we believe in the power of collaboration and autonomy by using the Shape-Up methodology. Our teams are small, self-sufficient units comprising a backend engineer, a frontend engineer, and a *product designer*. Working on projects we call 'pitches', you'll be given the freedom to define, implement, and refine solutions in 6-week cycles. It's a place where your creativity can flourish and your solutions can transform the way people find homes and landlords find people.

**Your role and experience:**  

As a UX Designer you will play a key role in shaping our products and overall user experience. You will work closely with product, engineering, and our customers to understand user needs and translate them into clear, intuitive solutions. This is a broad and hands on role with a lot of responsibility and influence.

**Example responsibilitie:**

  

* Conduct user research with our customers to inform design decisions
* Drive the full design process, from early exploration and flows to mockups and prototypes
* Define and evolve the design direction together with developers and product owners
* 

**Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of experience as a UX or Product Designer in digital product development
* A relevant education in design
* A deep understanding of UX, UI, and research
* Fluent Swedish and English, both spoken and written

**It is a plus if you:**

* Have experience working closely with developers
* Have previously worked in a startup environment, preferably within tech

**Why HomeQ?**

* Enjoy the pace of a fast growing scale-up while having the financial stability of Vend, the largest marketplace operator in the Nordics
* Solve a problem that everyone has a relationship with, make rental housing easier!
* Work in agile, small autonomous teams where you'll have a large impact
* Enjoy a work environment that values innovation and responsibility  

  

Ready to make rental housing more accessible? Apply now and join HomeQ!

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions that reshape industries.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an 6-month Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 



* Participate in all stages of the design process: research, workshops, ideation, prototyping, and delivery.
* Create user journeys, sketches, wireframes, and interactive prototypes based on insights.
* Work with Figma and other design tools for XR experiences.
* Conduct user interviews, workshops, and product testing.
* Design interfaces for XR headsets, including interaction methods (hand tracking, eye tracking, etc.).



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 



* Previous of relevant work experience in
 **UX/UI** 
 and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Self-driven, Detail-oriented, structured way of working.
* Ability to choose and adapt methods/tools to the situation.
* User-focused mindset and passion for solving real problems.
* Proficiency in
 **Figma** 
 .
* Curiosity and openness to new tools and workflows.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience in AR/XR product development.
* The chance to make real impact in a growing startup.
* Remote-friendly setup and flexible workspaces.
* Strategic involvement and contribution to a product launch.



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: UX Designer - 8 Month Fixed Contract
description:
Do you want to design intuitive, seamless, and engaging user experiences for Toca Boca World—an app loved by millions of kids around the globe?
   

  

 As a UX Designer on the Toca Boca World team, you’ll play a key role in ensuring that every player can enjoy smooth, meaningful interactions that support discovery, creativity, and unlimited play.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 In your day-to-day, you will design and refine engaging player experiences by creating clear, user-friendly flows, concepts, wireframes, and prototypes for new features and updates to Toca Boca World. You’ll ensure that every interaction is playful, intuitive, and aligned with our kid-friendly approach.
   

  

 Working closely with developers, artists, play designers, and producers, you will help drive UX solutions that support the team’s creative direction while always keeping the kids’ perspective at the center.
   

  

 You’ll also regularly use player data, prototypes, and usability testing—including playtests with kids—to iterate on designs, partnering closely with our User Research team. Ensuring accessibility and usability will be a core part of your work, balancing creativity with inclusive and high-quality user experiences.
   

  

**Is this you?**
 You are a UX Designer with strong problem-solving skill, and deep understanding of player behavior. You’re confident defining UX goals, shaping priorities, and ensuring alignment with both player needs and business objectives.
   

  

 You believe in inclusive design that allows kids and parents of all kinds to enjoy our games. You’re comfortable acting as a bridge between teams—advocating for UX considerations, maintaining high standards, and contributing to an engaging, player-centric product.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**What We’ll Be Looking For In Your Portfolio**
 We’d love to see mobile projects you’ve worked on, including insights into your design process. Show us the challenges you tackled, the problems you solved, your role, and your key learnings.
   

  

 We welcome alternatives, explorations, early concepts, and personal projects too. Experience designing for kids is a plus!
   

  

**This is us!**
 Toca Boca captures the spirit of play. We create digital toys and everyday products that are filled with fun and silliness that kids from any corner of the world can instantly relate to. Everything is designed from their perspective. We celebrate the diversity and quirkiness of their world and give them the freedom to play in ways that only they can.
   

  

**Good to know!**
 This position is full time and based in our Stockholm office with a hybrid working model. We apply a 6 month probationary period. You’ll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support with relocation. As we’re an international company, with over 20 nationalities working here, and millions of users all over the world, you need to be fluent in English. Your application should therefore be in English.

title: UX/UI Designer with Frontend Development Skills
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we create world-class gaming products with bold, uncompromising design and unmatched attention to detail. We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who doesn't just stop at the design phase — you also bring your ideas to life in code.
 



  





 You'll join a cross-functional product team with full ownership over the solutions you design, working on innovative and highly interactive user experiences seen by players around the world. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers to bring your ideas to life—creating products that are both beautiful and usable. Depending on your experience, you might implement parts of the frontend yourself or work alongside developers to ensure your vision is realized in the final product.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Lead UX and UI design efforts for new and existing products — from user flows and wireframes to high-fidelity mockups.
* Translate your designs into functional, responsive, and accessible frontend components using React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Partner with developers and stakeholders to iterate on solutions, run experiments, and refine interfaces based on user feedback and performance data.
* Build and maintain components in a shared design system, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.
* Advocate for user-centered design throughout the product development process.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have a strong background in UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing thoughtful, elegant interfaces and interaction design.
* Are fluent in modern design tools like Figma, and enjoy prototyping and testing user flows.
* Know how to write clean, maintainable frontend code using React and TypeScript.
* Are comfortable working with developers and understand how design decisions impact performance and implementation.
* Care deeply about usability, accessibility, and the overall user experience.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where experimentation is encouraged.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Familiarity with A/B testing, analytics, and data-driven design decisions.
* An understanding of game or entertainment product design patterns.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* Figma (or other tools you prefer) / Design Systems
* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 You don't need to know everything from day one. If you're a designer who loves to get your hands dirty in code, and you're passionate about crafting exceptional user experiences, we'd love to meet you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and help shape the future of interactive entertainment.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
**About If**
 Get the opportunity to work in one of the largest insurance companies in the Nordics. We enable almost four million customers to live their fullest lives by always being by their side if something unexpected happens. Insurance is all about life and creating great customer journeys. And it’s all about UX! We offer you a workplace with engaged colleagues that contribute with visions and goals that maximize our customer experience. You will be a part of an inspiring workplace where we value flexibility, work-life-balance, and believe in you.
   

  

 We have offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, and the Baltics.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a designer and user advocate, you will shape digital service experience in areas like digital sales, self-service, and enterprise systems to position If as the most caring insurance company. You will drive research and design processes, work closely with stakeholders, and stay on track with timelines.
   

  

**We offer**
 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.
   

  

 Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as a highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits


**About The Team**
 You will be working in a cross-functional team of very friendly people from various locations. Here you would get the opportunity to make your own footprint on the processes and gain a great insight into the world of serving our customers in If.
   

  

 You will spend your everyday with the team, but you will also be a part of the UX Chapter, with 12-14 other UX Designers. The Chapter is a home base for peer sparring, growing skills, sharing, and developing best practices within expertise.
   

  

 Besides your team and the Chapter you will also be a part of our great If Experience Design Community, which consists of 65+ skilled and engaged UX designers, UX researchers, and Service Designers. We all work with digital services and touchpoints for If customers. We design digital services for the full customer journey: learning about and buying insurances, onboarding, being insured and helping our customers recover from an accident or other types of loss. We are many designers in If and we think the best way to learn and improve is by sharing with one another - this is the backbone of our Experience Design Community.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You are a strongly skilled UX designer who is self-driven and you approach projects holistically, with a special eye toward technical and mechanical functions. You have experience working with complex systems in large organisations, where a balance of user experience and business viability is key.
   

  

 As our new Senior UX designer you will be the linchpin and central role in creating and maintaining consistent and unified services across all points of interaction with customers, and you are responsible for ensuring that all touch points is well-integrated and seamlessly connected, enhancing the overall user experience.
   

  

 You are able to drive design processes and be proactive. You have great stakeholder management skills, understanding both business and technical feasibility.
   

  

**You also have:**
* Relevant higher education and at least +5 years of experience as a UX Designer
* Experience in working with multi-disciplinary teams with a high technical complexity
* Deep knowledge and experience within UX (and UI)
* Experienced in working Figma design libraries
* Able to prioritize and execute complex projects/design needs with quality outcomes.
* Business understanding, ability to translate business needs into concrete requirements and design solutions
* Great understanding and showcase of product thinking, storytelling, and design
* Self-motivated and autonomous
* Strong argumentation and communication skills
* Fluent or proficient level of language knowledge of English - we work across the Nordics and Baltics


**Other skill we value:**
* Strong experience in App design is highly valued
* Deeper knowledge around using AI in the Design process


**Additional facts and the recruitment process:**
**Application deadline:** 
 21st of December 2025, but screening and interviewing will start immediately.
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 CV and portfolio in English. We will not consider applications where a portfolio is not attached.
   

**Work location:** 
**Stockholm (** 
 Bergshamra)
   

  

**Traveling:** 
 Several times a year in the Nordic and Baltic countries
   

  

**Start:** 
 As soon as possible
   

  

**For more information, please contact**
 Ylva Berghem, UX Chapter Lead at ylva.berghem@if.se

title: Staff Designer, Core Experience - Playback Experiences
description:
Spotify is seeking a Staff Designer to define and evolve the future of Playback Experiences — the heartbeat of Spotify’s multi-format experience. Playback Experiences is where everything comes together: sound, motion, interaction, and emotion, synchronized across every format. It’s where our identity shines, and where users feel closest to the content they love.
   

  

 As Spotify continues to expand across audio, video, and emerging interactive formats, this role will shape how playback feels, behaves, and scales. You’ll architect a cohesive, flexible framework that supports innovation and business growth while maintaining simplicity, delight, and design coherence across Spotify’s playback ecosystem.
   

  

 As a Staff Designer, you’ll define the architecture of the playback experience — how systems interconnect, how formats transition, and how users flow through Spotify’s core playback surfaces. You’ll bring structure to complexity, leading the design vision for a human and unmistakably Spotify experience.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Playback Vision & Systems Architecture: Lead the end-to-end vision and design strategy for Now Playing View on mobile, defining how playback operates and scales across all content formats.
* Design and evolve the systemic framework that unifies video, audio, voice, and interactive experiences, ensuring consistent logic, flexibility, and cohesion.
* Partner with engineering to shape technical design models, playback state transitions, and scalable interface patterns for future formats and capabilities.
* Drive the evolution of core playback surfaces; including the queue, playing scroll, and format transitions, ensuring fluid continuity across experiences.
* Collaboration & Craft Leadership: Partner cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Research, and Data Science to deliver playback experiences that balance innovation with stability.
* Collaborate across Experience to ensure playback design principles are cohesive and scalable across Spotify’s ecosystem. Set a high bar for craft and systems rigour, combining storytelling, motion, and interaction design with strong technical understanding and design-for-scale thinking.
* Innovation & Mentorship: Explore how AI and adaptive systems can enhance playback — from generative motion to personalized, context-aware experiences that deepen engagement.
* Mentor and develop designers within Play Design, elevating technical fluency and systems literacy.
* Contribute to and evolve Spotify’s design frameworks and principles for multi-format playback, ensuring scalability and design consistency across product lines.


 Who You Are
   

  

* A senior design leader experienced in systems-level product design at scale — fluent in connecting user experience, technology, and playback architecture.
* A leader skilled in Motion, Interaction, and prototyping, with a curiosity about simplifying technical intricacies into user-friendly solutions.
* Experienced working across multiple content modalities (audio, video, voice, live, interactive) and crafting for continuity across them.
* A confident collaborator who thrives in cross-functional, technically sophisticated product environments.
* Passionate about mentorship, enabling other designers to think in systems and scale their craft.
* Curious about the role of AI and adaptive intelligence in shaping more personal and expressive playback experiences. Energised by crafting experiences that feel alive, and uniquely Spotify.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the EMEA region as long as we have a work location (excluding France due to on-call restrictions).
* This team operates within the Central European and GMT time zone for collaboration.


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
   

  

 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Senior Service Designer (Fixed-Term Contract)
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now** 
 , we need to strengthen our Design team with a Senior Service Designer who will focus on turning deep user insights into impactful product and service experiences.
   

  

*This is a temporary position for 14 months, with no extension, starting from April 2026 to May 2027.*
**What you’ll do:**
 As Senior Service Designer, your overall responsibility is to drive a human-centered design approach and advocate for insight-centric innovation throughout the product vision and lifecycle. This role demands a blend of creativity, analytical thinking, and a deep understanding of human-centered design principles. You will work closely with the Design team, our Consumer Insights team, Creative Design Leads, and Product Managers to bridge business and user insights into product and service development projects.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* Lead or support product and research projects to build an understanding of user needs, behaviors and experiences that inform and improve our audio products.
* Represent the Service Design perspective within the Design team and other parts of the organisation.
* Be responsible for the Customer Lens perspective in key Product Discovery projects.
* Champion the user needs and drive the insight agenda and awareness in the product organisation.
* Support and coach other designers to conduct research projects/ validation studies in projects.
* Support and facilitate teams and stakeholders to understand the customer experience of our products, as well as the influencing factors to the experience.
* Continuously contribute and develop concepts, ideas, and solutions within the projects and activities you lead and participate in.
* Propose and implement improvements in ways of working and collaboration.
* Support Jr/ Mid Service Designers and actively share expertise/ knowledge.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are passionate about creating user-focused experiences that truly make an impact. You thrive on taking initiative, driving projects forward with energy and determination. You are a natural collaborator, building strong relationships and fostering teamwork across diverse groups. You always seek ways to improve, innovate, and elevate the way things are done.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* A Bachelor of Design or equivalent.
* 5+ years of working experience within the field of design for consumer products and services. Experience in the field of consumer electronics is a plus.
* You have designed experiences for digital, physical eco-systems and have an interest and curiosity for the enabling technologies which make these experiences possible.
* Experienced in building service prototypes.
* Experience in communicating design solutions and systems to key stakeholders.
* Demonstrated experience working closely with other digital and hardware project team roles (from product designers to developers).


**Does this sound like you?**
**Please apply with your CV in English and your portfolio.**
***Please note:***
*We will begin reviewing applications after
 **5** 
**January 2026** 
 .
   

  

 We look forward to seeing your application!*
**Our pledge:**
 We strive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.

title: Senior User Experience Researcher(Bangkok - Based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**We have only scratched the surface.** 
 The online travel industry is an extremely dynamic and competitive space. Our aim is to deliver compelling designs that create a world-class customer experience. You will have a key role in defining the future of our products that reach millions of customers. Despite our size, we operate in a startup-like environment.
   

  

**Work in the heart of Asia.** 
 This is an amazing opportunity if you're looking for an exciting adventure abroad while expanding your international research capabilities. You get a chance to live in one of the most beautiful and most visited cities in the world!
   

  

**This position is open to worldwide candidates and we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Bangkok.**
 Senior User experience Researchers own end-to-end planning, execution, analysis and reporting of research projects, and consistently achieve research outputs needed by Product teams to inform strategic decisions. The research findings of Senior Researchers impact Agoda's business success by informing Product teams regarding design or design process, end user experience, product direction, market strategy or similar.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Master Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, Information Science, Psychology, Social Science, or any related field
* 10+ years of relevant experience in consumer-facing business domains
* You are very comfortable with planning, scoping, conducting, analyzing and communicating research
* Experience with Qualitative and user-centered design methods (individual and group interviews, diary studies, direct observation, think-aloud usability testing, etc.)
* Experience with Quantitative research (metrics, survey design, response effects, sampling, crosstabs, and statistical concepts, etc.)
* Experience in evaluating, negotiating, and working with external research vendors
* Be able to describe user problems and business opportunities to a variety of stakeholders by leveraging both quantitative and qualitative data
* You are able to demonstrate critical thinking beyond business requests
* You are a great storyteller and communicator, able to speak fluently to business people, designers, engineers and other stakeholders (in English)
* You enjoy collaborative work in a dynamic, data-driven and creative environment


**Responsibilities:**
 General Role Expectations:
   

  

* Demonstrates critical thinking beyond explicit business requests
* Functions independently in all operational research tasks
* Leads core end-to-end research activities - including driving research objectives, hypotheses, methodology, execution, analysis, and communication


 Research Skills:
   

  

* Good judgement when evaluating research opportunities, e.g. importance, urgency, and impact for team
* Ability to reasonably challenge details of research requests, and propose solid research solutions
* Strong project execution with existing skills while constantly expanding his/her breadth and depth of abilities.
* Knowledge of approaches for both quantitative and qualitative research, effectively triangulating findings, methods, and theories with others.
* Application of tools and inspection methods to quantify the value and efficiency of research
* Ability to adopt and adapt well-established methods according to product/project situations, and innovate new methods in collaboration with more senior researchers
* Knowledge of or ability to quickly learn key software tools common in the field (e.g. for surveys, diary studies, analysis)
* Knowledge of data compliance and ethics in all of their activities.


 Collaboration & Collaboration:
   

  

* Drives cross-discipline/department collaboration via research insights/activities.
* Collaborates efficiently with other researchers and other disciplines, with clear commitments in case of shared ownership.
* Demonstrates excellent communication skills; tailors communication style for different audiences, concise and to the point, open to taking input and feedback


 Research Community Contributions:
   

  

* Contributes to the research community in one or more ways - sharing work/ methodologies, coaching and/or mentoring other core or junior researchers, screening of Research candidates


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
