title: Business Analyst
description:
**Till vår kund söker vi nu en Business Analyst.** 




  





**Om uppdraget:** 




 Vi söker en IT Business Analyst med bred IT-kunskap, god affärsinsikt med intresse och erfarenhet av förstudier och verksamhetsförändring med IT som bas. Givetvis med gedigen kunskap om kravhantering i tidiga faser såväl som inför till exempel upphandling, hantering av regulativa krav eller att krav-ställa funktioner.
 



  





**Din profil:** 




 Du har utöver yrkesskicklighet antagligen en bred palett av verktyg med dig för att hantera många olika situationer, kulturer och verksamheter. Du har tålamod och lätt att hålla igång en diskussion samtidigt som du leder den i mål. Du är strukturerad och tydlig med en planerad agenda och målsättning inför varje workshop. Du har lätt för att nätverka och lätt att ta vara på de idéer som kommer fram, men också en god förmåga att spendera rätt mängd tid på rätt sak med rätt prio. Samtidigt har du förmågan att skapa struktur, transparens och förenkla sammanhang i en komplex miljö.
 



  





 Som person är du positiv, nyfiken, prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap. Är analytisk, förbättringsfokuserad och kommunikativ. Du gillar att jobba tillsammans med andra, men är också självgående när det behövs.Du har förmågan att arbeta i både helhets och detalj-perspektiv, du vill förstå strategin och kopplar det du gör mot strategi och taktik. Du trivs med att vara spindeln i nätet, är flexibel och vågar ta egna initiativ. Du får saker att hända!
 



  





**Du bör ha:** 



* Relevant akademisk examen eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Arbetat som Business Analyst i större initiativ och verkat i gränslandet mellan verksamheten och IT
* Förmåga att nätverka och samarbeta med intressenter på olika nivåer
* Stor erfarenhet av att leda och driva workshops
* Stor erfarenhet att utveckla el ta fram nya processer
* Affärsdriv, gärna erfarenhet från att etablera nya kontor eller fabriker
* Kunskap inom agila metoder och ha tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska



  





**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm/Gäteborg
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
 



**Start:** 
 2026-03-02
 



  





**Ansök senast 2025-12-10** 




***Säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll utförs på kundens begäran.***




***Urval av kandidater sker löpande och annonsen kan tas bort tidigare.***




  





**Om Agiremus** 




 Sedan 2015 har vi hjälpt flertalet medarbetare att komma ut på arbetsmarknaden samt att nå sina karriärmål runtom i Sverige. Genom att skapa och bibehålla meningsfulla relationer med våra samarbetspartners kan vi presentera en bred rad av arbetsmarknadens mest attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för våra medarbetare och kandidater. Agiremus verkar inom de flesta branscherna, både inom privat och offentlig sektor.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder:
 



 Agiremus erbjuder dig som konsult en spännande och utmanande arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att utvecklas inom din roll. Vi bryr oss om dig som och strävar efter långsiktiga samarbeten. Som konsult hos oss ges du, förutom spännande uppdrag, möjlighet att dela din resa med andra konsulter. Med jämna mellanrum anordnar vi tillfällen för er att träffas genom olika aktiviteter. Självklart kommer du även att ha en engagerad kontaktperson hos oss som finns där som bollplank och stöd. Vi erbjuder dig även goda personalförmåner som:
 



  




* Anställning med fast månadslön.
* Semester enligt semesterlagen.
* Tjänstepension.
* Heltäckande sjuk och olycksfallsförsäkring dygnet runt, årets alla dagar.
* Friskvårdsbidrag m.m.



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Project Manager
description:
**Job description** 




 As Project Manager in the Network Expansion team at Recharge, you will play a key role in growing our network of ultra-fast EV charging stations in the Nordics. You’ll manage the full project lifecycle, from business case development to construction and commissioning of charging stations, ensuring efficient, high-quality rollouts that align with our financial goals and environmental ambitions.
 



 In this role, you’ll play a key part of the energy transition. Your work will make it easier for more people to choose electric mobility and help build infrastructure that truly makes a difference by accelerating our journey toward a zero-emission future.
 



 The role combines commercial evaluation and hands-on delivery to bring high-performing charging stations accessible to everyone. You’ll manage a portfolio of projects, often running in parallel, requiring strong prioritization, coordination, and execution skills. By working closely together with internal and external partners, you’ll ensure that each station is strategically located and helping us move toward a more sustainable future.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 



* Lead the full project lifecycle, from site development and planning to commissioning, ensuring on-time, on-budget delivery that meets high quality standards.
* Oversee a portfolio of parallel projects at various stages, driving effective timeline, budget, and stakeholder management while maintaining clear communication, regular status updates, and proactive risk handling.
* Coordinate stakeholders and cross-functional teams to ensure seamless project execution.
* Oversee external partners including site owners, consultants, DSO, installation vendors to secure efficient delivery and adherence to contract terms.
* Evaluate site opportunities and prepare capex investment cases using standard financial metrics (ROI, NPV, IRR, Payback Period).
* Ensure documentation, reporting, and handover processes are completed in a structured and professional manner.
* Proactively manage risks, troubleshoot issues, adapt to changing conditions and/or priorities and escalate issues with commercially viable solutions.



  





**Success factors** 



* Bachelor’s degree in engineering, renewable energy, economics, project management or a related discipline.
* Several years of relevant experience in project management, ideally within energy infrastructure, construction, or e-mobility.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and present capital investment business cases using standard financial metrics.
* Proven ability to lead cross-functional projects from planning to execution, ensuring alignment, delivery, and performance tracking.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to engage clearly and confidently with internal teams, external partners, and senior stakeholders.
* Fluent in English and Swedish, written and spoken.
* Finnish language skills, written and spoken, while not necessary for this role would be an advantage as we also have projects in Finland.
* Project management certification (PMP, Prince2) is an advantage.



  





 We believe that the right candidate has a genuine interest in the green shift, and is either already driving an EV or is very interested in doing so in the near future.
 



 You are an experienced and structured project manager who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You are confident in financial discussions, organized in execution, and proactive in overcoming obstacles. Naturally collaborative, you’re also confident leading independently, keeping projects on track and stakeholders aligned. You’re comfortable navigating ambiguity and change, maintaining focus and momentum in a rapidly evolving industry. Above all, you take pride in contributing to a strong team culture while taking ownership of your projects, delivering meaningful results and advancing the green shift together.
 



  





**What can we offer?** 




 We offer you a role within a team advancing sustainable transportation and creating a greener future. Your work will have a direct impact on shaping the electric vehicle future. Our core values are Care, Share and Dare where we focus on building a better future in a rapidly growing business, together.
 



  





 · Subsidized EV-charging
 



 · Flexible working hours and hybrid office
 



 · Development opportunities and career opportunities
 



 · An inclusive working environment in a Nordic company
 



 · Very good pension and insurance schemes
 



 · Health Insurance
 



 · Modern and central location in Moss / Oslo / Stockholm
 



  





**Interested?** 




 Do you want to start an exciting and meaningful journey with Recharge and have a lot of fun on the way? Please apply before January 5. Interviews will be conducted continuously and the position may be filled before end of application period.
 



 Recharge values diversity. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
 



  





**Place of work:** 
 at our office in central Stockholm. Some traveling will be required, primarily within the Nordic region. This role reports to Country Manager Sweden & Finland, Network Expansion.
 



  





**Application deadline:** 
 Please apply no later than 05-01-2026. Position open until filled. Please apply by uploading your CV and application letter through our recruitment system Nuu.
 



 Questions about the position can be directed to: Ida Tallskog, Country Manager Sweden & Finland, Network Expansion: Ida.Tallskog@rechargeinfra.com or through our recruitment system Nuu.
 



  





*We do background checks on relevant candidate via our partner Semac AS.*

title: Junior Raw Material Buyer
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

 As Junior Raw Material Buyer your main contribution will be to ensure that all fabrics and trims are developed to meet Acne Studios’ production quality standards in accordance with the production calendar, and to maintain good collaboration and strong relationships internally and externally.
   

  

 You will report to the Senior Raw Material Manager and will play a vital role in fulfilling the Raw Material Production function by:
   

  

* Coordinate purchasing and industrialization of raw materials
* Place orders with mills and factories for sampling and pre-production
* Maintain accurate data in PLM and ERP systems
* Track sampling deliveries and update teams on status and allocations
* Support redevelopments with Raw Material Manager and Team Lead to meet quality and design standards
* Manage timelines to ensure on-time bulk production
* Assist with sustainability standards, including traceability and technical data sheets
* Partner with Quality team on material testing from prototype to sampling
* Oversee global excess stock with factories and warehouses.


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* Proactive, action-oriented mindset with strong problem-solving skills
* Flexible and organized, able to prioritize effectively


**Qualifications & Experience**
* Degree in business or textile-related field
* Minimum 2 years’ experience in material buying, sourcing, or production—ideally in high-end fashion
* Advanced knowledge of fabric and trims production processes and quality standards
* Fluent in English with excellent communication skills
* High proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel


 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: Media Strategist
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com
   

  

**Role**
 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**Role Summary And Impact**
 As a Media Strategist at WPP Media, you’ll help shape media campaigns based on audience insights, channel knowledge, data, set KPIs, previous learnings, and strategic goals. You work closely with clients, Client Leads, and our in-house specialists to ensure our campaigns are continuously optimized and deliver real business value.
   

  

 We believe a great Media Strategist is naturally curious and stays up to date with the latest trends, formats, and platforms. You're excited about the opportunity to guide others, supporting the growth of junior team members and helping clients understand the evolving role of media.
   

  

 You bring a holistic view of media planning and understand how different channels work together to meet client objectives. In your role, you’ll collaborate with Media Managers, Media Executives, and specialists across disciplines. You’ll also be responsible for crafting briefs to ensure we get the best possible output from our specialist teams.
   

  

**Skills And Experience**
 We’re looking for someone who’s passionate about media, strategy, and creating impact. You don’t have to tick every single box, but here are some things that might describe you:
   

  

* You follow trends in marketing, media, data, and technology — and you’re curious to keep learning.
* You enjoy working collaboratively and believe the best ideas come from diverse teams.
* You take a creative and strategic approach to problem-solving, always with the client’s goals in mind.
* You understand how different media channels work together to create results, and you’re comfortable connecting media strategy to KPIs and business outcomes.
* You’re hands-on when needed and have an eye for both detail and the bigger picture.
* You’re comfortable in a dynamic, fast-moving environment and like to take initiative.
* You value an international work culture and are fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.


**Your Background Might Include**
* Around 5 years of experience working with digital media strategy from agency side.
* A solid understanding of the digital media landscape, and ideally, experience across other media types too.
* Experience presenting ideas and recommendations to different stakeholders.
* A degree in marketing, economics, communications, or similar — or equivalent experience.


**Life At WPP Media & Benefits**
 Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and we’re just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the cutting edge of marketing and advertising.
   

  

 In Sweden, our benefits include a SEK 3,000 wellness allowance, a 37,5-hour workweek, half-days and “klämdagar" off, 30 days of vacation, and two paid volunteer days per year. WPP Media Sweden is a member of Almega, and all employees are covered by a collective bargaining agreement (kollektivavtal), which ensures occupational pension, insurance, and other negotiated terms. We host regular team activities, knowledge-sharing sessions, and wellness initiatives throughout the year.
   

  

 WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.
   

  

  

  

 We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.
   

  

**Application**
 This is a full-time permanent position with a start date as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period. In addition to reviewing your CV and conducting interviews, our recruitment process includes a testing phase. Selection and interviews are ongoing, so please submit your application with your CV and cover letter as soon as possible.
   

  

 We believe that diverse perspectives make us stronger and encourage applications from people of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, feel free to contact Nils Wimby, nils.wimby@wppmedia.com. Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.

title: Java Developer
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
**Java Developer – Join Kambi Engineering in Stockholm**
 Are you ready to take your development career to the next level? Kambi Engineering is looking for a Java Developer to join our Stockholm-based team.
   

  

 With offices in Malta (HQ), Philadelphia, London, Bucharest, Manila, Sydney, Uppsala, and Stockholm, we’re a global team of 950+ passionate, highly skilled individuals. We pride ourselves on being at the forefront of the sports technology industry. Here's your chance to be a part of our success story!
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Java Developer, you’ll help strengthen our teams’ ability to turn user stories into high-quality, shippable code. To succeed in this role, we believe you should have previous experience in building scalable and maintainable applications that run and fail gracefully. You should possess both theoretical and practical knowledge of agile and/or lean software development.
   

  

 At Kambi, we strongly believe in self-organized teams. You’ll work in a cross-functional, self-managing team where you will:
   

  

  

* Participate in discussions, grooming sessions, and retrospectives to continuously improve our product and processes.
* Collaborate with Product Owners to share technical insights.
* Troubleshoot and solve production incidents in a complex, high-performance environment.


**Tools & Frameworks**
 Here are some of the tools and technologies we use in our backend teams:
   

  

  

* Java / Kotlin
* REST/Json
* Linux
* AWS
* Helm
* Kubernetes
* Apache Kafka
* Git
* Postgres
* Redis


 We operate in DevOps teams, which means you’ll have the opportunity to take full ownership of our products and components, from idea to deployment and support. This also includes being on call.
   

  

**What We Look For**
 To fit well in our team, you should have a curious mindset, be triggered by challenges, and love working collaboratively. You’re passionate about development, eager to learn, and thrive in an environment where knowledge-sharing is key. As an international company, our main working language is English.
   

  

**What’s in It for You?**
* An opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing international company.
* We operate in the AWS cloud and offer an exciting environment where you can grow and learn.
* The ability to influence your team’s work environment and processes directly.
* Access to continuous learning: internal training, industry conferences, hackathons, and other collaborative events.


 At Kambi, we believe in the importance of work-life balance and making it part of our everyday culture. We believe that both you as well as Kambi benefit from having happy, healthy colleagues. You will join one of our Stockholm-based development teams with a hybrid work setup.
   

  

 We’re curious about your story. If you’d like to meet us, please apply with your CV.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: Projektledare / Projektkoordinator
description:
We are looking for more project managers/project coordinators with an engineering background to join the Product Development Stockholm team!
   

  

**About This Vacancy**
 As an Employeneur in the ProD team, you will work with production development alongside our clients around Stockholm. The tasks are varied and include project management, design, problem-solving, and process coordination. Working with others in a dynamic environment with interdisciplinary fields will sharpen your technical skills as well as your social abilities when collaborating with your colleagues.
   

  

**What We Expect From You**
 We are curious about you if you are a trained university or civil engineer and preferably have 5 years of experience working as a designer or in project management. Since you will be working on continuous improvements, this should be something that motivates and interests you. We assume that you are fluent in both English and Swedish. It is advantageous if you have previous experience in: - Mechanical design - Beneficial knowledge of PLM/PDM systems such as: OAS/FRAS - Experience in the Automotive industry, Defense, Energy - Agile project management / Scrum
   

  

**What You Can Expect From Us**
 In the role of Employeneur, you will not only develop your technical skills but also drive your own development and business. You become part of an innovative and entrepreneurial organization where the focus is on continuous development and the opportunity to take responsibility for steering your own career. Since TMC is an international company, we can offer projects in various locations across different countries where we and our clients are present. Currently, we are represented in Sweden, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Luxembourg, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Hungary, U.A.E., USA, and Canada. The world becomes your workplace!

title: Fältservicetekniker
description:
Som Fältservicetekniker hos Tre ingår du i ett övergripande team som är placerade i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Tillsammans ansvarar vi för att våra kunder alltid upplever att vårt nät har en mycket hög tillgänglighet. Tre är unika med att vara enda svenska operatören med drift i egen regi!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Denna roll tillhör Stockholmsregionen. I huvudsak kommer du arbeta med vår utrustning såsom transmissionsutrustning, radiobasstationer inklusive antennsystem, radiolänk, kylsystem och kraftutrustning. Stockholmteamet ansvar också över siter från Norra Kronoberg till Norrland samt Gotland. Vi på Tre finns där våra kunder är och våra siter utökas i Sverige i takt med vart våra kunder befinner sig.
   

  

 Vi tekniker sätter stor stolthet att vara ute på fält och att på plats bilda oss en uppfattning, göra riskbedömningar och snabbt skrida till handling för att se till att vår utrustning på siten fungerar som det ska. Vi går på schemalagd beredskap på ett veckovis rullande schema året runt och har en fantastisk teamkänsla där vi ställer upp för varandra.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande och det ligger delvis i ditt ansvar att planera din dag. Vanliga uppgifter är felsökning och åtgärder i fält, planera och preventivt underhåll, utbyggnad och installation samt justering och byte av antennutrustning i radio och transmissionsutrustning. Stor del av vår arbetsdag sker ute i fält i omväxlande väderförhållanden och det ingår frekvent fysiska moment och arbete på hög höjd såsom i mast eller takarbeten. Arbetsområdet är stort då siterna är utspridda över hela regionen. Det gör att man i rollen ofta är på resande fot och det kan förekomma långa sträckor i bilen.
   

  

**Du kommer se fram emot att**
* få stora möjligheter att bredda dig inom din roll och vara med på vår resa där ny teknik samt funktionalitet ständigt levereras.
* arbeta tillsammans med kompetenta och erfarna kollegor som känner stor stolthet i vårt uppdrag och som arbetar kontinuerligt med att leverera Sveriges mest driftsäkra mobilnät.
* Vara en del av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work samt att vi är stolt samarbetspartner till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar


 ,
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 För att lyckas i rollen är du självständig, flexibel och trivs av att arbeta i en omväxlande miljö som innebär arbete både inomhus och utomhus, ensam eller tillsammans med kolleger samt beredskapstjänst. Du är van att ta egna beslut, ibland på begränsat underlag av information.
   

  

 Du är nyfiken och inser den unika möjligheten i att lära dig hur ett mobila nätverks alla delar fungerar. Vårt team präglas av prestigelöshet och en vilja att ställa upp för våra kolleger – det är egenskaper som också du besitter.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har god IT-vana såsom test, olika system, felsökning, nätverk och ett brinnande intresse att lära dig om teknik. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av service- och underhållsarbete från klimatanläggning eller elarbete är detta en fördel. Du har B-körkort och eftersom bilkörning är en stor del av rollens vardag ser vi att du mycket god körvana och är trygg bakom ratten. Vidare kan du uttrycka dig väl i både tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Den här rollen kräver ett mastintyg där det ingår hälsokontroll från våra leverantörer, som givetvis Tre står och ansvarar för. Detta är ett obligatoriskt steg i processen och aktuella kandidater kommer underrättas.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du bifogar CV och svarar på de frågor vi ställt nedan i samband med att du söker. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll görs på slutkandidat
   

  

**Välkommen till Tre!**

title: Automationsingenjör
description:
Välkommen till Custodia Consulting - Upptäck möjligheterna att växa med oss!
   

  

 Vi söker nu en automationsingenjör till ett uppdrag med fokus på produktion, teknik och underhåll. Du kommer analysera och optimera automationslösningar samt stödja underhåll och drift. Uppdraget är perfekt för dig som vill kombinera tekniskt kunnande med möjligheten att påverka och förbättra verksamhetens processer.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Som automationsingenjör arbetar du med automation, industriell IT samt styr- och reglerteknik, med fokus på att optimera och underhålla tekniska system i produktionsmiljöer. Du ansvarar för att ge tekniskt stöd, både genom förebyggande och avhjälpande underhåll, och bidrar till att säkerställa hög teknisk tillgänglighet.
   

  

 Rollen passar dig med ett starkt teknikintresse, särskilt inom styrsystem, som vill utveckla lösningar, förbättra processer och arbeta i en miljö där kontinuerlig utveckling och förbättring står i centrum.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Avancerad felsökning, modifiering och förvaltning av PLC och HMI.
* Delta vid driftsättning och kvalificering av ny utrustning.
* medverka i förbättrings - och projektarbete.


 Du kommer även att vara en del utav Custodia teamet där du kommer att ha en direkt inverkan på vår kultur, värdegrund och utveckling.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* Har ingenjörsexamen inom Automation.
* 5 års erfarenhet av automation inom relevant bransch
* Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* God kännedom om SHE (Safety, Health och Environment) är ett måste.
* Stark kompetens i PLC, SCADA system, Motion/Servo, Robotar.


****Det är meriterande om du har****
 Dokumenterad erfarenhet av automation och GMP är meriterande, liksom erfarenhet av arbete med TPM/LEAN och liknande förbättringsarbete.
   

  

****För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:****
* Du har en stor drivkraft
* Du är van att arbeta självständigt såväl som i team.
* Du har förmåga att skapa goda relationer samt stark vilja att samarbeta i ett team.
* Du är är analytisk och bra på att dra logiska slutsatser.


 Om oss
   

  

 Custodia Consulting är ett konsultföretag med stort fokus på prestation med avsikt att skapa mervärde. Vi erbjuder högkvalitativa tjänster inom Projektledning, teknik, Life Science och digitala lösningar. Vår vision är att bygga starka och konkurrenskraftiga team med människor från olika bakgrund, livs- och arbetslivserfarenhet. Genom att bygga våra team med våra värderingar tror vi starkt på att skapa värde för våra kunder, men också för våra anställda.
   

  

 Vi på Custodia främjar arbetsglädje och välmående. Vi kommer därför att ha kontinuerliga avstämningar och workshops, där vi kan vara öppna och transparenta, utbyta erfarenheter och diskutera idéer.
   

  

 Vi har ett stort kontaktnätverk samt täta samarbeten med större konsultbolag, vilket gör det enklare för oss att placera våra konsulter i rätt uppdrag.
   

  

 Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

****Våra kärnvärden:****
* Integritet - Vi tar ansvar och är ett dedikerat och pålitligt team.
* Kvalitet - Vi levererar fantastiska resultat utan kompromisser.
* Inkludering - Alla är viktiga, vi skapar mångfaldiga och högpresterande team som kan skapa värde för våra kunder.


****Din karriär hos oss:****
 Vår passion för tillväxt och utveckling sträcker sig inte bara till våra kunder, utan även till våra medarbetare. Som ett växande konsultbolag erbjuder vi spännande karriärmöjligheter där du kan växa och blomstra tillsammans med oss.
   

  

 Vi tror på att investera i våra talanger och skapa en miljö där du kan utvecklas professionellt och personligt.
   

  

 Samtliga konsulter på Custodia har även en affärsmässig roll för att bidra till bolagsetableringen och tillväxten.
   

  

 Vår rekryteringsprocess
   

  

 Vi tillämpar löpande urval. Första steget är en telefonintervju, där vi går igenom din bakgrund och motivation. Därefter följer en djupintervju, där vi utforskar din kompetens och erfarenhet mer ingående.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en objektiv och rättvis rekryteringsprocess och arbetar aktivt för att motverka diskriminering i enlighet med diskrimineringsgrunderna. Vår målsättning är att rekrytera på ett inkluderande och kompetensbaserat sätt, där alla kandidater bedöms utifrån sina meriter.
   

  

 Gå med oss på Custodia och skapa en framgångsrik karriär!
   

  

 Läs mer på våran hemsida.

title: Strategic Sales Executive - Lending/Credit Solutions (Nordics)
description:
We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented
 **Sales Executive** 
 with a proven track record in
 **selling technology or software solutions** 
 to
 **financial institutions** 
 , particularly in the areas of
 **lending, loans, and/or mortgage solutions** 
 . In this role, you will be instrumental in expanding our footprint across the Nordic market, by identifying opportunities, engaging stakeholders, and driving end-to-end sales cycles.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Drive new business development and manage the full sales lifecycle for SAP Fioneer lending solutions
* Identify, prospect, and engage new financial institutions to generate fresh business opportunities in the lending domain
* Build and maintain strong relationships with C-level executives and key decision-makers at banks, credit unions, and other financial institutions
* Understand customer pain points and align SAP Fioneer's product offerings to address lending, loan origination, and mortgage servicing challenges
* Collaborate with product, pre-sales, marketing, and delivery teams to tailor value propositions and proposals
* Stay up to date on industry trends, competitive landscape, and regulatory developments in the financial services lending domain
* Meet or exceed assigned sales targets and KPIs


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in B2B sales, with a strong focus on financial institutions
* Must have deep domain knowledge in areas of commercial lending, loan and credit risk management. Experience in the area of mortgage finance and development finance are appreciated.
* Demonstrated success in selling complex software/SaaS solutions in a competitive environment with strong regional connections and market knowledge to help grow our business in the Nordics.
* Strong consultative selling skills, with the ability to understand client needs and propose tailored solutions
* Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills
* Fluency in English and Danish, Norwegian or Swedish
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, global environment
* Willingness to travel as needed
* Prior experience working with or selling SAP, core banking, or loan management platforms and understanding of financial services regulations and compliance requirements in lending is an advantage


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to shape the fast-changing financial services landscape.
* Flexibility to work and gain experience in different areas of the company as you grow your career.
* Fast-paced scale-up type culture with an experienced team, strong brand, and an enviable product portfolio.
* Work with some of the smartest and most driven individuals around the world.
* Competitive compensation package and countless growth opportunities.
* Flexible working policy, so you can work when and where it's comfortable for you.
* Lean hierarchy environment with focus on your growth in providing individual career paths.

title: Backend Engineer, Core Experience
description:
**Experience Mission**
 The Experience Mission designs Spotify’s consumer experience—end to end, moment to moment, across every screen, platform, and partner integration. Our mission is to make listening feel effortless, personal, and joyful for billions of users around the world. That means turning complexity into clarity across hundreds of touch points —from our mobile and desktop apps to the smart speakers, TVs, cars, and integrations where Spotify shows up every day. If it touches a consumer, we shape it. We bring deep insight into human behavior, design, and technology to craft experiences that feel intuitive, expressive, and unmistakably Spotify.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Meadow sits within the CoreX studio and builds the backend services powering entity pages in the Spotify mobile app—such as artist, album, playlist, and other foundational surfaces.
   

  

 You’ll join a collaborative team of backend and client engineers working closely with partners across Studios to shape and scale the future of Spotify’s listening experience for millions of users worldwide.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design, build, and operate backend services that are reliable, low-latency, and ready to scale globally.
* Partner with engineers and product teams across Spotify to design APIs and data flows that power user-facing experiences.
* Take ownership of your services end-to-end, including operations and on-call participation.
* Evolve our architecture to support new features, performance improvements, and long-term technical health.
* Use experimentation and data to drive decisions and improve feature quality.
* Participate in code reviews, technical discussions, and continuous improvement practices.
* Learn, grow, and contribute to Spotify’s engineering culture through collaboration, knowledge sharing, and curiosity.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You know how to build and maintain backend services, ideally using Java or a similar language.
* You have an understanding of data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems concepts.
* You care about reliability, testing, observability, and continuous delivery.
* You are familiar with tools commonly used at scale, such as Git, BigQuery, Grafana, JUnit, and PagerDuty.
* You are comfortable using AI tools to improve developer workflows and boost productivity.
* You are curious, proactive, and eager to learn new approaches and technologies.
* You enjoy collaborating with others and shaping both systems and ways of working.
* You have experience exploring or applying GenAI to improve developer experience or engineering efficiency.
* You are excited about building backend services that power user-facing experiences at massive scale.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm or London.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know – we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Business Developer - Sweden
description:
**Join Our Growing Team**
**BE AWAKE FOR THE FIRST TIME IN YOUR LIFE**
**About The Role**
 Results, growth, profit — this is the mindset we are looking for.
   

  

 We are looking for business developer with entrepreneurial DNA - a builder, a driver, and challenger - to join our journey for a world where people sleep well.
   

  

 We seek individuals who raise the bar beyond what others think is possible, and then deliver on it. Are you business minded and know how to turn strategy into execution and execution into results and want to excel in a performance-based culture with no ceiling on potential earnings?
   

  

 This is your opportunity to take ownership, shape your market together with our partners and make a lasting impact on a global luxury brand.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build and inspire: Develop and empower our retail partners to reach new heights of performance.
* Own your market: Lead Hästens’ growth in your region with an entrepreneurial mindset – act as an owner, not an employee.
* Drive results: Open doors, close deals, and create opportunities others only dream of.
* Execute: Design and implement business action plans that redefine success.
* Represent: Strengthen Hästens’ position as a global luxury brand through your strategic leadership.
* Leadership: Travel, negotiate, and influence at the highest levels across your region, with occasional trips to Sweden and other international destinations.


**Skills And Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, or a related field (Master’s degree is a plus).
* Proven entrepreneurial spirit – you take ownership, show initiative, and deliver without waiting for direction.
* Ideally some experience from founding, scaling, or leading a business.
* Strong commercial acumen with a focus on creating mutual growth with partners.
* Demonstrated record of achieving and exceeding ambitious targets.
* Experience in luxury sales, retail, or HNWI customer relationships is advantageous.
* Strategic, fearless, and competitive – you play to win and inspire others to do the same.
* Analytical and action-oriented – you plan, execute, and own your results.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Valid EU driver’s license with flexibility to travel approximately 80%.


**Some things we offer**
* A global stage where your performance is recognized and rewarded.
* The freedom and responsibility to act as an entrepreneur within a fast-growing international brand.
* The opportunity to compete and win at the highest level in luxury retail.
* A performance-based culture where ambition, leadership, and results are celebrated.
* Unlimited earning potential for those who deliver exceptional outcomes.


**About Us**
 Since 1852, Hästens Beds has been committed to crafting the best sleep. The skilled craftspeople at our factory in Köping, Sweden, have been refining our work for generations. Every bed is bespoke and made by hand using only the best natural materials. The difference lies in the details and our quest to provide the most restful sleep for people who want to lead a higher quality of life. We are proud to be a world-class international brand, operating in more than 50 countries with over 300 partners in Europe, Asia, America and Africa – and still growing.

title: Senior Software Engineer (IaaS)
description:
Everyone's story matters. Come shape your story with us at Riverty.
   

  

**But where does that take you?**
 To one of our 30 hybrid workspaces – designed for exchanging ideas, learning from others, and shaping the way we work. An international community of over 4,000 people, representing almost 80 nationalities across 11 countries. United by one mission: Combining empathy, advanced technology and data-driven insights to keep people and businesses in flow. With payments made for them. So that they don't have to worry about it.
   

  

**And there's more:** 
 We are part of the family-owned Bertelsmann group. Established. Corporate. In a fast-paced industry. We enable flexible payments in various industries, simplifying the financial management of known brands and helping people repay debt to build financial confidence. In short: shaping FinTech.
   

  

**We are looking for**
**Senior Software Engineer**
**to join our team at our location in Stockholm**
**(Y)our Mission:**
 Our solutions contribute to flexible and customer-friendly payment alternatives. We allow consumers to choose when and how they want to pay, guaranteeing merchants a steady and predictable cash flow. Our products make us proud, but not content, and we have high ambitions for our existing and upcoming products. We’re now modernizing and strengthening one of our key products with renewed focus in the Nordics — backed by the strength of a global group, but with the energy and ownership of a startup. You’ll join a newly formed product & tech team, helping shape how we work and how we grow as we double down on building sustainable, human-centric FinTech solutions.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* In this role, you will work as a full-stack engineer, primarily focusing on backend tasks and having smaller front-end responsibilities. You will join one of our products, and your daily tasks will be:
* Design, develop, test, and ship robust, maintainable, and readable software, applications, APIs, and other workflows.
* Attend regular scrum ceremonies as a member of an agile cross-functional team.
* Analyze, discuss and implement business requirements while maintaining good documentation of the systems and components you create.
* Adopt, implement, and provide feedback on organizational and industry standards and practices that will positively impact on our engineering culture.


  

  

**What will help you to succeed in the role:**
* A university degree in the IT field
* Hands-on experience with C# and the .NET framework.
* Experience in frontend development with any modern JavaScript framework (e.g., Angular).
* Some experience in developing, shipping, and maintaining cloud-based applications.
* A good understanding of RESTful APIs.
* Familiarity with microservices and distributed architecture is a plus.
* Experience with relational databases, preferably SQL Server.
* Knowledge of cloud development and experience with Azure is a bonus.
* Written and spoken English proficiency to communicate and collaborate with our international team.


**About the technologies we use:**
 Our teams have autonomy regarding tech choices. The example below will give you some insights, and we look forward to discussing this further.
   

  

 All solutions developed cloud-native targeting Azure - Infrastructure defined using Terraform - Services deployed to Kubernetes clusters by default - A growing microservice ecosystem with event-based integration - Using latest .NET Core - RESTful API design - Single-page frontend apps served by CDN - Frontend tech using TypeScript, often Angular or standard Web Components (Stencil) - Automated tests in each layer - Design collaboration using Figma.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
   

  

 We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Trade Lead - Sustainability Regulatory
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a
 **Trade Development and Operational Lead for Sustainability Regulatory** 
 you will play a key role in interpreting current and upcoming sustainability-related regulatory frameworks that may impact H&M’s business activities, particularly in relation to international and local trade flows. Your responsibilities will include updating internal global processes to enable seamless, compliant implementation of sustainable regulatory frameworks across our global trade operations. You will help us deliver exceptional customer experiences while staying ahead in a rapidly evolving trade landscape with increasing sustainability-related requirements.
   

  

 In this role, you will bring deep expertise in sustainability regulations affecting international trade and customs, advising and supporting strategic initiatives, operational excellence, and regulatory compliance requirements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Lead and provide regulatory advise on sustainability topics across strategic, developmental, and operational areas, where an area of focus will be environmental and human rights-related aspects connected trade of goods.
* Define, develop and follow-up global Trade standards and guidelines based on best practice with a focus on ensuring compliance with relevant sustainability regulations such as EUDR, CBAM, ESPR, DPP, FLR and similar frameworks.
* Monitor developments in sustainability regulations and assess their global impact on H&M Group
* Monitor and optimize data and KPIs related to Trade&Customs identify trends and highlighting opportunities and issues
* Collaborate across functions, including production, logistics, tech, legal, public Affairs and other relevant teams, to ensure seamless implementation and full compliance with sustainability regulations.
* Ensure compliance to latest legal requirements in Trade processes particularly within the sustainability regulations area, by continuously monitoring and driving internal controls/audits and by close collaboration with Regional Trade teams
* Actively stay up-to-date on global logistics end-to-end operational status, KPIs, issues and risks related to sustainability regulations and assess their global impact on H&M Group


**Who You Are**
* You hold a university degree in a relevant field such as International Trade, Law, Sustainability, Environmental Studies, or similar.
* You have solid experience working in the field of Global and International trade with particular focus on sustainability regulations such as EUDR, CBAM, ESPR, DPP, FLD and similar.
* Skilled at supporting strategic initiatives and ensuring operational and regulatory compliance.
* A strong networker with existing relevant network of contacts in the field of Global Trade and other key stakeholders.
* Analytical and structured, with excellent planning and prioritization skills.
* A clear and inspiring communicator who brings others onboard with confidence.
* Persistent and solution-oriented, taking ownership to overcome challenges.
* Proactive and results-driven, unafraid to challenge the status quo.
* Well-organized and a forward-looking thinker.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at our head office in Stockholm. Ready to take the leap? Apply now with your application latest by
 **20th** 
**December 2025** 
 . We are excited to welcome you to our team and start this incredible journey together!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

 WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE
   

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

title: Brand Director
description:
**FUZED is looking for a Brand Director** 




 At FUZED, we’re building one of the most exciting youth brands in the Nordics — empowering the next generation to move more, connect more, and feel part of something bigger through the power of gaming. Our vision is bold: gaming as a force for good in culture, community, and health.
 



 Now, we’re looking for a Brand Director to define and amplify that vision — shaping how FUZED shows up in the world, what we stand for, and how we win the hearts of kids, parents, and partners.
 



 If you’re driven by building iconic brands, creating meaningful storytelling, and turning strategy into real growth and cultural impact — this role is for you.
 



  





  





**Who are we?** 




 FUZED is a gaming & health company from Stockholm redefining what gaming can be for the next generation. Instead of treating screen time as the problem, we turn it into the solution — a bridge to movement, community, confidence, and real-world belonging.
 



  





 Gaming is now the largest youth culture in the world — and with that comes a responsibility and an opportunity to build something that truly matters. Through our connected arenas, events, and mobile app, kids earn screen-time by being active: walking to school, scoring goals, joining local tournaments and youth activities, or playing fun motion-tracked games in our mobile app FUZED Arcade at home.
 



 We partner with municipalities and leading brands to build a community where gaming becomes a driver for well-being, not a barrier. Our brand sits at the intersection of gaming, sport, youth culture, and public health — inspiring kids to move together and feel part of something bigger.
 



  





 We’ve only scratched the surface of what FUZED can become. Now, we’re looking for a Brand Director to help shape the identity, voice, and cultural impact of a movement built for the next generation.
 



  





  





**Why is this interesting?** 




 Youth physical and mental health is declining, and screen time is rising faster than ever. Yet gaming remains the strongest cultural force among young people. Cities want to engage youth. Parents want healthier screen habits. Brands want meaningful connections.
 



  





 FUZED bridges these worlds — turning screens into motivation, social play into physical activity, and digital interests into real-world movement.
 



  





 As Brand Director, you’ll shape how that story is told and experienced — defining the emotional connection young people, families, and partners feel when they think of FUZED. You are the voice, the style, and the cultural heartbeat behind a movement built for the next generation.
 



  





  





**What will you do?** 




 You will take full ownership of the FUZED brand — defining what we stand for, how we look, how we sound, and how we show up in culture. This includes:
 



  




* Developing and maintaining our brand platform — values, identity, storytelling, and design system — adopted across our app, arenas, events, campaigns, and partnerships
* Setting the go-to-market and marketing roadmap, prioritizing the right channels to reach kids, parents, and municipalities effectively
* Leading Creative Direction — ensuring everything we publish feels premium, consistent, and unmistakably FUZED
* Building and running a high-performing content engine with strong variation: motion, photo, stories, creators, community, education
* Translating our brand into major partnerships (Nike, LEGO, EA Games etc.) to unlock cultural and commercial impact
* Working tightly with product, events, and sales — making sure branding is aligned with the experience and drives growth
* Defining and tracking core brand & marketing KPIs — using insight to continuously improve narrative, formats, and engagement



  





  





**Leadership & Team Building** 



* Build, coach, and inspire a growing brand and creative team as we expand
* Establish scalable processes that enable creativity, speed, and quality
* Create a culture of excellence that attracts top creative and marketing talent to FUZED



  





 This is a strategic and hands-on role — where your creativity and leadership directly shape how thousands of young people perceive FUZED as a movement.
 



  





  





**Who are we looking for?** 




 Someone who blends strategic brand thinking with world-class creative execution — a hybrid of brand architect and creative leader who cares deeply about consistency, culture, and emotional connection.
 



  





 You have:
 


* Proven experience building and managing a modern brand identity
* Strong capability in storytelling, campaign development, and creative quality control
* Experience activating brands across digital, social, events, and partnerships
* A good understanding of marketing analytics — and willingness to continuously learn and optimize for growth
* Clear communication skills that bring alignment between creative, business, product, and operational teams



  





 And you bring:
 


* A brand-led mindset — you protect and elevate what the brand stands for
* Humility and confidence — able to both inspire and execute
* Curiosity for culture, youth behavior, and what’s next
* High ownership — you set the bar and make sure we reach it
* Passion for FUZED’s mission: helping kids move, connect, and thrive through gaming



  





  





**Why join FUZED?** 




 Because the work you do will matter.
 



 You’ll build a brand that inspires healthier habits, deeper belonging, and a more positive relationship with gaming for an entire generation. You’ll work alongside a passionate, mission-driven team — shaping something that doesn’t exist anywhere else in the world. A brand with purpose at its core, and culture in its DNA.
 



  





  





**Ready to build something unforgettable?** 




 Apply now and help build one of the most exciting youth brands in the world — a movement that empowers kids to be active, connected, and confident through the culture they love.

title: Scada-ingenjör
description:
Systemingenjörer SCADA
 
**Med människor i fokus och rötter i traditionell automation är vi en av Sveriges ledande leverantörer av resurseffektiviserande system för energi, infra och industri. Vi tar ett helhetsansvar för både stora och mindre projekt med el, kraft och automation. Vi levererar även hela anläggningar där vi utöver våra automationslösningar tar ett totalansvar - människor, montagelösningar och mekanik. Genom att kombinera projektförmåga, branschkunnande och teknisk kompetens, skapar vi framgång och utveckling för både medarbetare och kunder. Våra resurser har vi samlade i eget hus vilket ger oss en värdefull samverkan och kontinuitet i projekten. För oss handlar projektförmåga om att skapa konkurrenskraft åt och tillsammans med våra kunder. Överallt där industriproduktion effektiviseras och utvecklas har Granitor Systems en naturlig och viktig roll att spela.** 




 Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra till en grönare framtid? Som systemingenjörer SCADA en del av Granitor Systems, blir du en viktig del av ett kompetent och engagerat team. Vi arbetar med externa kunder inom energisektorn och strävar efter att skapa hållbara energilösningar för framtiden. Detta är en unik möjlighet att delta i uppdrag som påverkar Europas elmarknad, med fokus på innovation och energiomställning. Om du vill utveckla ett starkare, smartare och grönare energisystem – ansök nu! Vi välkomnar alla sökande, även om inte alla krav uppfylls, eftersom vi tror på mångfald och utveckling inom teamet.
 



**Dina arbetsuppgifter:** 




 I rollen som systemingenjör kommer du att arbeta med kundens SCADA-systemet. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar bland annat databasunderhåll, Arbetsuppgifterna i detta uppdrag innebär att genomföra PTP-tester i labbmiljö. Teamet för PTP-tester kommer att bestå av en testledare från kunden.
 



 Kontinuerligt under projektets gång valideras migrerade data och bilder i syfte att säkerställa kvalitén. En viktig aktivitet under slutfasen av valideringsarbetet är punkt-till-punkt tester (PTP-tester). Dessa går ut på att testa fjärrhanterade objekt mellan kundens nätstationer och det nya systemet.
 



 Efterleva Granitor Systems värderingar om säkerhet och integritet, och bidra till en positiv arbetsmiljö.
 



**Bakgrund:** 



* Högskoleexamen med teknisk inriktning.
* Minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med elkraft
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med drift- och övervakningssystem (SCADA system).
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av punkt-till-punkt tester eller andra strukturerade tester i SCADA-system eller andra industriella IT-system som vi bedömer som relevant.
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med kontrollanläggning i nätstationer och/eller stations RTU (Remote Terminal Unit) och/eller kommunikation mellan nätstation och driftcentral.
* God skriftlig och muntlig kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska



**Vad vi erbjuder:** 




 Kollektivavtal och flexibel arbetstid.
 



**Bra att veta:** 




**Placering:** 
  Stockholm Omfattning: heltidstjänst
 



**Säkerhetsprövning:** 
  Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning hos oss kan det vara ett krav på 
 **svenskt medborgarskap** 
  i vissa befattningar. Säkerhetsprövning av kandidaten kan komma att krävas!
 



**Beredskap/Jour:** 




 Beredskap eller jour kan innebära att du ingår i en beredskapsgruppering och har ansvar att vara tillgänglig under vissa tider. Hur ofta detta inträffar beror på hur många personer som ingår i teamet – ju fler personer, desto mer fördelas beredskapstiden.
 



**Kontaktperson:** 




 Siamak Hashemi (Gruppchef), siamak.hashemi@granitor.se
 



**Rekryteringsprocess:** 




 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så sök nu! och skriftlig kommunikationsförmåga

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a** 
**platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, We Cut Out Everything Unnecessary To Give More Back To You As a Consultant. And We Have Done It In The Package Of a Lean And Efficient Organization, Meaning No Overpaid Managers, No Fancy Offices And No Extravagant Conferences. Instead We Give You
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Java Developer** 
 at Coody, you’ll help build and scale new and existing products with real end-to-end ownership of the service, the code, and the outcomes. Assignments are typically 6–24 months, and as a consultant you’re expected to ramp up quickly and deliver value from day one. While your home base is backend Java, you’ll sometimes work across the full tech stack (e.g., frontend, integrations, cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, data flows) to ship complete solutions. You’ll design and build scalable, robust applications in cloud environments, contribute to architecture and testing/automation, and play an active role in a high-trust, high-performing team.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We Are Seeking a Java Software Engineer With At Least 5+ Years Of Experience. You Must Have a Proven Ability To Get Things Done. Here’s What We’re Seeking
   

  

* 5+ years of experience building backends with Java
* A cloud native background using Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS / GCP / Azure and Terraform - or such.
* Experience from additional languages such as TypeScript, JavaScript, Scala, Kotlin etc. is also appreciated.
* A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Based in Sweden: You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Customer Success Manager EMEA - Spanish Speaking
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**What You’ll Do**
 You’ll be the face of Legora for our clients post-sale - guiding them from onboarding through adoption, expansion, and renewal. Specifically, you will:
   

  

* Own the customer journey for a growing book of highly intellectual clients - leading law firms and legal teams across Europe and beyond.
* Lead onboarding and implementation, ensuring clients are set up for success from day one.
* Proactively drive product adoption and usage through structured enablement, regular check-ins, and tailored success plans.
* Act as a strategic advisor: understanding client goals, uncovering new use cases, and helping teams realize maximum value.
* Identify expansion opportunities and then own the commercial negotiation, taking responsibility for renewals and upsells.
* Monitor customer health metrics and take initiative to reduce churn risk and drive retention.
* Closely collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Marketing to translate client feedback into actionable insights.
* Help build and refine our Customer Success playbook - we’re building this machine together. We are just getting started on this and your input will not only be appreciated but expected.


**What You Bring**
 You care deeply about customer outcomes - and you know that successful adoption doesn’t just happen. You’re proactive, strategic, and deeply comfortable working with demanding clients. You take pride in being the reason customers stay, grow, and succeed.
   

  

**We’re looking for**
* 5–7 years of Customer Success, Account Management, or related experience in a high-growth B2B SaaS environment. Account Executives with experience owning full sales cycles will also be considered.
* A track record of driving customer retention, expansion, and satisfaction.
* A hunter mentality. Someone who is comfortable going out, finding and closing commercial opportunities.
* Experience working with legal, compliance, or other regulated/complex industries and clients - or just ridiculously good at learning as you go.
* Strong project management and onboarding experience; you keep things moving and your clients confident.
* Excellent communication skills; written, verbal, and interpersonal in Spanish and English.
* You can manage high-level conversations with legal leaders and roll up your sleeves with hands-on teams.
* High EQ and commercial instinct, meaning you know when to listen, when to advise, and when to act.
* A love of fast-paced, early-stage environments where you help build the playbook, not just follow it.
* Comfortable with metrics - driven by data, customer health, and outcomes over process.
* Someone who enjoys being in the office 5 days a week. A key component of Legora’s success has been in-person collaboration and we want you to be part of that.


**What We Offer**
* At Legora, you’ll have the chance to build long-term, strategic relationships with some of the world’s leading law firms - working on truly impactful problems from day one.
* You’ll be part of a fast-scaling, entrepreneurial environment where your ideas matter and your growth is a priority.
* As an early member of the Customer Success team, your work will be visible, meaningful, and closely connected to both our clients and our product evolution.
* You’ll collaborate with senior leadership and cross-functional teams, helping shape not just customer outcomes but how we engage and support legal professionals across the globe.
* We offer a competitive salary, a high-upside equity program, and full support for relocation to our centrally located Stockholm office - designed for focus, energy, and great collaboration.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Shift Manager till Five Guys - Sergels Torg
description:
**You'll Be Enthusiastic About**
* Perfect Burgers and Fries
* Our values; Competitive, Enthusiastic, Family, Get It Done and Integrity
* People - Leading from the front and being hands on
* Customer service


**What You'll Be Doing**
* Responsible for Crew & Quality Control
* Supporting the General Manager in the delivery of perfect burgers and fries.
* Provide an “above and beyond” experience for your team while creating an awesome working environment where people are happy to come to work and have fun, as you are part of the management team.
* Ensuring every customer is delighted with their order and their Five Guys experience - You will deal with complaints promptly in an open and honest way.
* You will ensure that each shift runs as smoothly as possible and that our values form part of your shift management.
* You will be expected to lead from the front, you will be hands on most of the time, working on the line and dining room.


**INCREDIBLE CAREERS WITH FIVE GUYS**
* If you are ambitious and want to grow - we can provide you with support and the right tools to build a career with us.
* Your next step would be an Assistant Manager.
* Five Guys isn’t just a job – it can be a career!

title: Kundtjänstmedarbetare i uppdrag mot Telia
description:
Releasy Customer Management AB är en outsourcingpartner inom kundservice med flertalet uppdragsgivare inom branscher som telekom, media, e-handel, resor och offentlig verksamhet. Releasy tar hand om sina uppdragsgivares kundservice och försäljning i alla kanaler, exempelvis sociala medier, chatt, mail och telefon. Releasy har verksamheter i Sverige, Norge och Finland med ca 1800 anställda.
   

  

 Vill du bli grym på kundservice och försäljning? Möta fantastiska kundupplevelser, jobba med den senaste AI-tekniken och dessutom få chansen att utvecklas och växa i din roll? Då ska du söka till oss på Releasy!
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
**Som Kundtjänstmedarbetare På Releasy Kommer Du Att**
* Representera Releasy och vår uppdragsgivare Telia, ett av Sveriges mest framgångsrika företag inom IT- och telekombranschen.
* Vara den primära kontaktpunkten för kunder via samtal. Andra kommunikationskanaler som chatt och mail kan förekomma.
* Hantera kundförfrågningar och lösa eventuella problem med fokus på att tillgodose kundens behov.
* Arbeta aktivt med merförsäljning och leverera lösningar som gör skillnad för kunden.
* Fokusera på service och support, inklusive administrering och fakturafrågor om våra kunders tjänster och abonnemang.
* Ge korrekt information om produkter/tjänster samt vägleda kunder genom olika processer.
* Arbeta aktivt för att säkerställa hög kundnöjdhet och skapa minnesvärda upplevelser för våra kunder.


 För att du ska få en bra introduktion i arbetet börjar anställningen med 30 dagar utbildning kombinerat med praktiskt arbete. Det är en ständigt lärande och utvecklande miljö där du med tiden kommer få lära dig nya saker och utvecklas.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med 6 månaders provanställning. Det är varierande arbetstider förlagda inom uppdragets öppettider som är måndag-fredag 08:00-19:15 samt lördag 09:00-17:15. Utbildningsstart är 2026-01-08.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer och färdigheter**
* Gymnasieexamen
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i engelska både muntligt och skriftligt
* God dator- och systemkompetens
* Starka kommunikationsfärdigheter
* Tidigare erfarenhet av kundbemötande service eller försäljning är meriterande


 Vi söker dig som är självgående och har en passion för att leverera förstklassig kundservice. Du drivs av att arbeta målinriktat och strävar efter att uppnå utmärkta resultat, med en stark motivation för merförsäljning. Du har en naturlig förmåga att förutse problem och hitta praktiska lösningar. Dessutom kan du hantera stress och snabbt anpassa dig till nya situationer i din dagliga arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Ansökan och process**
 Är du den vi söker efter? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Ansökningar hanteras löpande vilket innebär att rollen kan bli tillsatt innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 På Releasy är det viktigt att varje ansökan hanteras rättvist och objektivt. För att säkerställa att vi rekryterar rätt medarbetare använder vi en strukturerad rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Processen inleds med urvalsfrågor där vi säkerställer att grundkraven för tjänsten är uppfyllda. Därefter får du en inbjudan till bakgrundskontroll, som du själv hämtar och tar del av innan du väljer om du vill dela den vidare med rekryterare. Automatiska system kan komma att vara involverade i processen, men alla beslut fattas av människor. Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i syfte att säkerställa en trygg och rättvis rekryteringsprocess. Det är en del av vårt kvalitetsarbete och hjälper oss att skapa en säker arbetsmiljö för både våra kunder och medarbetare.
   

  

 Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att bli inbjuden till tester och intervjuer, där vi fokuserar på att utvärdera din kompetens och potential att lyckas i rollen. Vi genomför även digital referenstagning för att verifiera tidigare erfarenheter och få en bredare bild av din arbetskapacitet.
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare på:
 *namn.efternamn@releasy.se*
**Vi hanterar vår rekrytering internt och undanber oss vänligen kontakt från rekryteringsfirmor**

title: T Arkitekt
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*
**Rollen**
 Vi söker en IT-arkitekt som kan bidra till att våra kunders verksamheter inte bara är effektiva och affärsmässigt optimerade, utan också uppfyller organisationens högt ställda säkerhetskrav. Du har gedigen erfarenhet av att identifiera och hantera potentiella risker, med särskild kompetens inom integrationsarkitektur. I rollen ingår att säkerställa att nya lösningar och system exempelvis vid upphandling alltid utvärderas och anpassas för att möta verksamhetens krav och riktlinjer.
   

  

**Erfarenhet**
* Har erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera IT-arkitektur med fokus på skalbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda
* Erfarenhet av systemintegration, mikrotjänstarkitektur och API-hantering
* Erfarenhet av att se till att systemdesign och implementation följer best practices för säkerhet och regelefterlevnad
* Deltagit i tekniska roadmap-diskussioner och strategiarbete för att säkerställa långsiktigt hållbara lösningar
