title: Scrum Master
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* We are looking for a servant leader that has a strong personal drive and commitment to meet complex challenges.
* You are a "people person", where your passion is to develop and motivate others.
* You possess excellent communication skills that helps you create passion and engagement.
* Building networks to understand and solve obstacles comes natural to you.
* As a person, you bring stability and drive for reaching results.
* You will be acting in a context with many different perspectives, it is essential you are good at handling changes and dealing with ambiguity.
* You also excel in stakeholder management as well as adapting the Scrum Framework to the team's context and needs.
* We believe you have a technical education on university level.
* You have at least 3-5 years of experience from Scrum Master roles preferably in hardware context.
* Experience from Line Management or other leadership roles will be considered a plus.
* Your communication skills in English, both written and oral are on excellent level.

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 12-12-2025  


  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Tech Lead
description:
Are you driven by the challenge of developing next generation digital solutions that create real impact for users and businesses? If you’re a builder at heart, strategic, and deeply technical - this is an opportunity to join a team where your work directly shapes the future of manufacturing innovation.
Some words about your new workplace
The Digital Offer and Innovation team at Seco is growing and looking for a Senior Technical Lead to help us push boundaries, explore innovative technologies, and bring scalable, customer-centered solutions to the market. We’re part of a global team with strong local presence. We offer flexibility while keeping you connected to peers and collaborators across our European locations. Our culture is open & collaborative and together we build meaningful digital products and services that scale!
About the job
In this position, you’re at the intersection of technology, product, and business. You drive the architecture and development of new digital solutions, from zero-to-one prototyping to production-scale deployments. Working closely with product leads, AI counterparts and offer teams, you translate ambitious product vision into scalable, resilient solutions. You accelerate our product development cycles by applying modern engineering practices, including AI/ML, cloud-native architecture, and low-code/no-code platforms.
Your job isn’t just about building solutions – it’s about enabling the entire organization to move faster, think bigger and deliver meaningful value while managing technical decisions at the same time.
This role is based in Europe with flexible location options, preferably close to one of our Seco offices.
Your profile
You are a technical leader with a strong software engineering foundation and a proven ability to turn product ideas into scalable digital products and services. You excel at solving complex technical problems, driving architectural direction, and collaborating closely with product and business teams. Challenging assumptions, asking the right questions, and pushing for first principles thinking, comes naturally to you. You’re comfortable working hands-on, exploring new technologies, and guiding teams with your expertise while mentoring, sharing knowledge, and creating space for others to grow.
Need-to-have technical experience* Hands-on full-stack software engineering depth, with strong experience designing scalable, secure, cloud-native (Azure/AWS) and API-driven systems.
* Proven technical leadership or solution architecture experience, driving key technical decisions and system designs.
* Practical expertise in modern engineering practices, including AI/ML integration, CI/CD, DevOps, and automated testing.


Leadership & collaboration* Ability to influence decisions across teams without formal authority
* Strong communication skills to articulate technical decisions to engineers, product/offer teams and executives
* Experience mentoring developers and improving engineering practices
* Comfortable challenging assumptions and finding pragmatic solutions under evolving requirement


Mindset & ways of working* A builder at heart - you enjoy getting into the code as much as shaping architecture
* A systems thinker with a strong product sense and business awareness
* Naturally collaborative, curious, and proactive in driving clarity and direction


Nice-to-have* Experience in industrial software, manufacturing or hardware-integrated environments
* Exposure to high-tech companies/startups, or modern digital product organizations
* Familiarity with low-code/no-code platforms to speed up prototyping


Our Seco culture
At Seco, we're united by a spirit of collaboration and a shared curiosity to learn and grow. We take responsibility for our actions, stay focused on our customers, and believe in winning together. For us, it’s also clear that our diversities form an amazing foundation for achieving great results. Curious about our workplace and benefits? Read more on our website. You’re also welcome to visit our LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us and our products further.  

Contact information
For further information about this position, please contact Sujay Murthy, hiring manager, at sujay.murthy@secotools.com.
We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
Union contacts – Sweden* David Romlin, Unionen, +46 (0)70-608 46 90
* Jörgen Andersson, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-548 10 70
* Benny Christiansen, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-523 50 60


Recruitment Specialist: Anna Pettersen
At Seco, we value work-life balance and due to the holidays, it may take a little bit longer until we reply in this process.  

How to apply
Send us your application no later than January 2nd, 2026. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0085421.
For more information about our recruitment process, please contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER**


Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? At Permobil, we’re looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.


At **Permobil**, the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.

**Position Overview**  

  

As a **Machine Learning Engineer**, you will play a key role in building the AI core that powers Permobil’s next generation of intelligent systems – ranging from internal copilots and automation agents to customer-facing assistive technologies. In this role, you will design, deploy, and optimize the models and pipelines that bring advanced intelligence into our platform. Working within a modern Azure AI ecosystem, you will connect LLMs, embeddings, knowledge graphs, and real-world business data to create production-ready AI solutions that deliver measurable impact. You will collaborate closely with AI developers, data scientists, and backend engineers to transform cutting-edge models into scalable, secure, and well-governed AI services that support Permobil’s mission to improve lives through innovation.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design and implement ML pipelines for model training, evaluation, and deployment using Azure Machine Learning, AI Foundry, and Fabric Notebooks,
* Build and maintain retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and embedding pipelines leveraging Azure OpenAI Service, Cognitive Search, and Azure Storage,
* Develop robust data ingestion and preprocessing workflows using Fabric or Databricks,
* Implement continuous training and evaluation loops following MLOps principles in Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions,
* Collaborate with AI developers to integrate models into production services such as FastAPI, gRPC, or event-driven architectures,
* Monitor and optimize model performance, cost, and latency across multiple environments,
* Contribute to internal SDKs for model orchestration, feature engineering, and evaluation frameworks.

**Qualifications & Skills:**

* Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field,
* Strong proficiency in Python and modern ML frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow,
* Deep understanding of Azure Machine Learning, AI Foundry, and the broader Azure AI/ML ecosystem,
* Experience deploying and scaling models using AKS, App Services, or Azure Container Instances,
* Solid experience working with data pipelines and feature engineering using Data Factory, Fabric, or Databricks,
* Strong understanding of vector search, embeddings, and RAG architectures,
* Familiarity with CI/CD practices, model registries, monitoring, and ML governance principles,
* Experience working in agile development environments,
* Fluency in English; proficiency in Swedish is considered a plus.

**Meriting skills:**

* Experience with LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and custom embedding generation,
* Knowledge of orchestration frameworks such as LangChain, Semantic Kernel, or similar tools,
* Exposure to Azure Cognitive Services, Responsible AI practices, or AI governance frameworks,
* Background in data-centric AI, including evaluation and benchmarking of generative model quality.

**Who are you?**  

  

You are a leader who inspires and motivates those around you, using your influence to drive collaboration and alignment across teams and stakeholders at all levels. You communicate clearly and actively, ensuring that ideas are shared, understood, and acted upon. You embrace experimentation and encourage others to do the same, understanding that innovation often comes from taking calculated risks. You see failure not as a setback, but as a stepping stone – an opportunity to learn, grow, and ultimately achieve better results. Your mindset fosters a culture of curiosity, resilience, and continuous improvement.

**Why is Permobil the next step for you?**

* **You’ll make a difference. Every day.**
  

Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* **You’ll make your mark as part of our future.**
  

We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
* **You’ll feel welcome from day one.**
  

We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.

**Application Process**


We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before **January 10th** at the latest!


Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.  

  

For more information about the position, please contact Christoffer Stigson, Director Digital Transformation, christoffer.stigson@permobil.com  

For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com

***Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.***

**More about Permobil**


Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.  

Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 2 000 team members in 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

title: Senior Tech Lead
description:
Are you driven by the challenge of developing next generation digital solutions that create real impact for users and businesses? If you’re a builder at heart, strategic, and deeply technical - this is an opportunity to join a team where your work directly shapes the future of manufacturing innovation.
Some words about your new workplace
The Digital Offer and Innovation team at Seco is growing and looking for a Senior Technical Lead to help us push boundaries, explore innovative technologies, and bring scalable, customer-centered solutions to the market. We’re part of a global team with strong local presence. We offer flexibility while keeping you connected to peers and collaborators across our European locations. Our culture is open & collaborative and together we build meaningful digital products and services that scale!
About the job
In this position, you’re at the intersection of technology, product, and business. You drive the architecture and development of new digital solutions, from zero-to-one prototyping to production-scale deployments. Working closely with product leads, AI counterparts and offer teams, you translate ambitious product vision into scalable, resilient solutions. You accelerate our product development cycles by applying modern engineering practices, including AI/ML, cloud-native architecture, and low-code/no-code platforms.
Your job isn’t just about building solutions – it’s about enabling the entire organization to move faster, think bigger and deliver meaningful value while managing technical decisions at the same time.
This role is based in Europe with flexible location options, preferably close to one of our Seco offices.
Your profile
You are a technical leader with a strong software engineering foundation and a proven ability to turn product ideas into scalable digital products and services. You excel at solving complex technical problems, driving architectural direction, and collaborating closely with product and business teams. Challenging assumptions, asking the right questions, and pushing for first principles thinking, comes naturally to you. You’re comfortable working hands-on, exploring new technologies, and guiding teams with your expertise while mentoring, sharing knowledge, and creating space for others to grow.
Need-to-have technical experience* Hands-on full-stack software engineering depth, with strong experience designing scalable, secure, cloud-native (Azure/AWS) and API-driven systems.
* Proven technical leadership or solution architecture experience, driving key technical decisions and system designs.
* Practical expertise in modern engineering practices, including AI/ML integration, CI/CD, DevOps, and automated testing.


Leadership & collaboration* Ability to influence decisions across teams without formal authority
* Strong communication skills to articulate technical decisions to engineers, product/offer teams and executives
* Experience mentoring developers and improving engineering practices
* Comfortable challenging assumptions and finding pragmatic solutions under evolving requirement


Mindset & ways of working* A builder at heart - you enjoy getting into the code as much as shaping architecture
* A systems thinker with a strong product sense and business awareness
* Naturally collaborative, curious, and proactive in driving clarity and direction


Nice-to-have* Experience in industrial software, manufacturing or hardware-integrated environments
* Exposure to high-tech companies/startups, or modern digital product organizations
* Familiarity with low-code/no-code platforms to speed up prototyping


Our Seco culture
At Seco, we're united by a spirit of collaboration and a shared curiosity to learn and grow. We take responsibility for our actions, stay focused on our customers, and believe in winning together. For us, it’s also clear that our diversities form an amazing foundation for achieving great results. Curious about our workplace and benefits? Read more on our website. You’re also welcome to visit our LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us and our products further.  

Contact information
For further information about this position, please contact Sujay Murthy, hiring manager, at sujay.murthy@secotools.com.
We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
Union contacts – Sweden* David Romlin, Unionen, +46 (0)70-608 46 90
* Jörgen Andersson, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-548 10 70
* Benny Christiansen, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-523 50 60


Recruitment Specialist: Anna Pettersen
At Seco, we value work-life balance and due to the holidays, it may take a little bit longer until we reply in this process.  

How to apply
Send us your application no later than January 2nd, 2026. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0085421.
For more information about our recruitment process, please contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
At Pricer, we’re redefining what’s possible in retail technology. As a global leader in digital shelf and in-store automation solutions, we empower retailers to make smarter, faster decisions through cloud-driven, real-time connectivity. Pricer’s customers are leading retail chains around the world within grocery, consumer electronics, DIY, and pharmacies.
  
We’re now seeking a hands-on Engineering Manager who combines technical depth with inspiring leadership. You’ll play a key role in driving the evolution of our cloud platform — leading a talented software team, influencing architectural direction, and ensuring we continue to deliver world-class, scalable solutions to customers around the globe.
  
  

**The Role:**  

* Lead and mentor a team of skilled software engineers building cloud-native services and APIs powering Pricer’s connected retail ecosystem.
* Stay close to the technology — engage in architecture reviews, technical discussions, and occasionally contribute to code.
* Drive best practices in software engineering, DevOps, and cloud infrastructure to ensure quality, security, and performance at scale.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, QA, and Operations to align technology with strategic goals and delivery timelines.
* Encourage innovation, experimentation, and continuous improvement — fostering a culture where engineers take ownership and pride in their work.
* Champion a modern, agile approach to software delivery with clear, measurable impact.


**Who we are looking for:**  

* Proven experience as an Engineering Manager, Tech Lead, or Senior Software Engineer in a cloud-first environment.
* A genuine passion for mentoring people and teams, developing talent, and enabling others to do their best work.
* Strong background in software development (Java, C#, or similar) and a solid grasp of distributed systems and API design.
* Hands-on experience with Cloud development, including containerized or microservice-based architectures.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, and monitoring at scale.
* The mindset of a builder — proactive, curious, and eager to take ownership of both challenges and results.
* Previous experience as Agile Coach or Scrum Master is advantageous


Why Pricer?
  
* Shape the future of connected retail through technology that impacts millions of customers worldwide.
* Join a global, growth-oriented company with the agility of a startup and the stability of an established leader.
* Work in a culture that values innovation, accountability, and collaboration.
* Enjoy a flexible, supportive environment where ideas are heard and initiative is rewarded.
* Be part of an engineering organization that’s scaling fast — and wants you to grow with it.
* Guided by our core values—We dare, We care, We win together—we foster innovation, collaboration, and empowerment, while prioritizing trust, responsibility, and teamwork to drive success for our customers, partners, and employees.
* Our office in Hagastaden, Stockholm, offers a dynamic and innovative workplace where teamwork is at the core of everything we do. We also provide great opportunities for professional development and we work on a hybrid basis, preferably three days per week at our office.


Ready to lead, build, and make an impact?
  
Join Pricer and help us craft the intelligent, cloud-connected retail solutions of tomorrow.
  
  

**Application Process:**  

* This role is managed by UNQ Recruitment, and we kindly ask recruitment and consulting firms not to contact us directly. All applications and initial interviews will be conducted by them.
* If you have any questions about the role, please contact Nina Sejdini via email at nina@unqgroup.se.

title: Informationsingenjör
description:
På Sigma Technology sätter vi dig som konsult i fokus. Vi erbjuder dig goda möjligheter till utveckling och en variation av uppdrag. Vi tycker att det är viktigt att du trivs på jobbet och att vi får ha roligt tillsammans. Vi tror också på långsiktighet och lägger stor vikt på dina personliga egenskaper och din vilja att utvecklas i konsultrollen. Just nu söker vi seniora informationsingenjörer och teknikinformatörer.
  
Vill du skapa tydlig och användarvänlig teknisk information som gör komplex teknik begriplig? Vi söker en erfaren teknikinformatör som vill bidra med sin kompetens i ett spännande uppdrag inom industrin. Du blir en nyckelperson i arbetet med att utveckla dokumentation som gör skillnad för operatörer, servicetekniker och användare.
  
Om rollen
  
  

**Som senior teknikinformatör kommer du att:**  

Skapa, uppdatera och kvalitetssäkra teknisk dokumentation såsom operatörsinstruktioner, manualer, underhålls- och reparationsanvisningar samt mjukvarudokumentation.
  
Strukturera information i relevanta system och mallar (t.ex. CMS/PLM) och arbeta enligt etablerade standarder som S1000D, iSpec 2200 och Simplified Technical English (STE).
  
Samla in data genom intervjuer, fotografering och granskning av tekniskt material.
  
Säkerställa att dokumentationen följer gällande standarder, riktlinjer och kundkrav.
  
Samarbeta med ingenjörer, utvecklare och produktspecialister för att säkerställa korrekt tekniskt innehåll.
  
Bidra till förbättringar av struktur, språk och användarvänlighet i dokumentationen.
  
  

Din profil
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

8–10 års erfarenhet som teknikinformatör eller teknisk skribent med industriteknisk som huvudfokus.
  
Relevant utbildning inom teknisk information eller motsvarande teknisk bakgrund.
  
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och teknisk engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  
Erfarenhet av XML, SGML och CMS-miljöer (t.ex. Uptime 4) samt gärna CCMS-verktyg.
  
Kunskap om maskindirektivet och maskinsäkerhet.
  
Förmåga att förstå och förmedla komplexa tekniska koncept på ett enkelt och tydligt sätt.
  
Ett tydligt eget driv, förmåga att arbeta självständigt och skapa goda relationer.
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Fördjupad kunskap inom S1000D och STE.
  
Erfarenhet av verktyg som Corena, Arbortext, PLM, Catia och/eller DevOps.
  
Erfarenhet av Photoshop och Adobe Illustrator.
  
  

Om uppdraget
  
**Omfattning:** 100%
  
**Plats:** Karlskrona, arbete sker på plats.
  
  

Vill du vara med och skapa teknisk information som gör skillnad? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

title: Team Manager to Retail/PB OMS team, Tech Trading Equities \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. As a leading financial services group in northern Europe, we’ll help you grow and empower you to take on more responsibility to create a real difference. SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics.  

Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future-proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?  

  

We are now looking for a driven and engaged Team Manager for our Retail/PB OMS Team **About the role:**
As a Team Manager for our Retail/PB OMS teamwithin Tech Trading Equities, you will play a key role in coaching and supporting the team on its journey toward becoming even more self-organized. You will operate in a fast-paced environment and contribute to the continuous delivery of modern trading systems.  

Working in an Agile setting, you will collaborate closely with development teams and Product Owners to ensure the team has the right conditions to succeed. You are comfortable challenging the status quo and encouraging experimentation, new ways of working, and continuous learning—both as a team and as individuals. You thrive on improvement and view reflection and feedback as essential for success.
The team is part of the Wealth domain and will work closely with WAM Tech, a new area within Technology focusing on savings, trading, and investment offerings.  

Currently, the team consists of four employees and one consultant based in Stockholm. The team is expected to grow, and as Team Manager, you will have a crucial role in supporting and guiding this expansion**.**
### **As a Team Manager, you will:**

* Have a strong understanding of modern development practices, Agile methodologies, and continuous delivery.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to influence and inspire.
* Support the team’s performance, delivery, and KPIs. Remove impediments and provide guidance while empowering teams to make their own decisions.
* Work closely with the POs and other stakeholders, both within the Domain and cross SEB.
* Coach career/competence development and performance management.
* Drive and take initiative to ensure the team delivers in the most efficient way.
* Try new things and challenge behaviors to learn more about yourself and the team.
* Handle financials, keeping within cost frames, and proactively drive efficiency in the short and long term.
* Build a feedback culture that thrives in the agile context.

### **To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**

* Long experience working with Trading products within Equities, Derivatives, Fixed Income or similar products.
* Knowledge of Trading applications, Electronic trading, Fix-protocol, Exchange connectivity and similar is meriting**.**
* You combine strong leadership skills with deep technical expertise.
* Knowledge within C++, GO, DevOps and CI/CD is meriting.
* Solid experience in software development and solution design.
* The ability to act as a Tech Lead when needed, guiding the team in technical decisions and ensuring architectural integrity.
* Proven track record of leading in an efficient and agile way.
* Willingness to constantly develop yourself, learn new things, and build strong relationships with stakeholders.
* Experience collaborating with external vendors to deliver comprehensive solutions.
* A team player attitude and approach, thriving in high-performing teams and enjoying coaching and supporting your surroundings.
* Well-developed oral and written communication skills in both Swedish and English, where you easily visualize your ideas and interact with stakeholders within both Business and IT.

### **What we offer:**

* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits

**Ready to Join?**It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 10th of December. If you have questions about the position, please contact Katarina Skagerlund at katarina.skagerlund@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.  

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
https://sebgroup.com/career
https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Solution Engineer
description:
Do you want to be part of a team that guides and supports Sandvik in their cloud journey? At Sandvik Group IT, we’re now looking for a Solution Engineer to join our Cloud Advice Team – a role where you combine hands-on technical work with advisory and collaboration.
This is an exciting opportunity to tackle challenges and help teams unlock the full potential of cloud technology. Here, you’re part of a feedback-friendly environment where learning, sharing knowledge, and celebrating differences are key.
About the job  

You work closely with product teams, architects, and stakeholders to maximize the value of our cloud platforms, primarily in Azure. You handle requests from various business areas, troubleshoot complex issues, and ensure best practices are followed. This is a hands-on role where you configure services, migrate resources, and act as a trusted advisor to teams adopting cloud. You also contribute to building reusable assets and knowledge within the organization.
Your tasks include:* Designing and deploying cloud solutions.
* Configuring and optimizing Azure resources.
* Troubleshooting identity, networking, and security issues.
* Migrating workloads from on-premises to cloud.
* Advising teams on governance, security, and cost optimization.

  

This position is based in Stockholm or Sandviken, Sweden, with a hybrid work setup.
Your profile  

You have solid hands-on experience in cloud services, mainly Azure, and understand enterprise-scale environments. You’re skilled in scripting (PowerShell, Python), Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), and familiar with DevOps practices and tools like GitHub or Azure DevOps. You understand multiple IT domains such as security, networking, and identity management. Acting in a global environment calls for fluency in English.  

You’re curious, proactive, and eager to learn. You thrive in a collaborative environment, communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical audiences, and have a strong customer focus. Problem-solving comes naturally to you, and you enjoy working hands-on while building relationships across teams with a service mindset.
Our culture
Our role is clear – through every action, every day, we make the shift and advance the world through engineering. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career options. Are you intrigued? Visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
Contact information

title: Data platform engineer inom Azure
description:
* Ansök senast: 21 december 2025
* Stockholm
* Hybrid
**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------

Vi söker en Platform Data Engineer som vill vara med och bygga och vidareutveckla vår molnbaserade dataplattform i Azure. Bli en del av en stor kundcentrerad organisation där vi arbetar nära slutanvändaren.


**Ditt team**  

Du blir en del av ett teknikfokuserat team bestående av Cloud Data Platform Engineers, Data Engineers och en Produktägare/Product Manager. Tillsammans arbetar vi enligt agila principer, med ett gemensamt ansvar att konfiguyrera, utveckla och underhålla vår molnbaserade data- och analysplattform samt dataflöden. Teamet kännetecknas av stort samarbete, hög teknisk nivå och en kultur där kvalitet, affärsnytta och lärande står i centrum.


**Din roll**  

Som Platform Data Engineer arbetar du med att bygga, konfigurera och förbättra de tekniska komponenter och underliggande infrastrukturella lösningar som utgör grunden för vår Azure-baserade dataplattform. Du ansvarar för att möjliggöra skalbara, säkra och effektiva dataflöden för hela organisationen. Rollen innefattar både utveckling och driftperspektiv, med stort fokus på Infrastructure as Code, automation och robust plattformsarkitektur.


I rollen ingår bland annat att:


* Konfigurera, utveckla och underhålla vår Azure-baserade data- och analysplattform med hjälp av Infrastructure as Code
* Bygga, förbättra och automatisera dataflöden och integrationer inom etablerade ramverk och best practices
* Sätta upp, drifta och vidareutveckla lakehouse-arkitektur
* Arbeta i CI/CD-miljöer för att effektivt kunna utveckla, testa och distribuera plattformsförändringar
* Säkerställa hög nivå av IT- och molnsäkerhet, särskilt kopplat till nätverk, åtkomstkontroller, datahantering och plattformsarkitektur
* Bidra till utvecklingen av vår dataarkitektur och driva förbättringar i plattformen
* Samarbeta nära med flera affärsavdelningar för att omsätta data till insikter och möjliggöra analys

Du kommer att arbeta med moderna Azure-tjänster och relaterade verktyg för databehandling, lagring och analys. Rollen ger dig stort utrymme att påverka och forma hur vår molnbaserade dataplattform byggs och vidareutvecklas.


**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

* Tjänstepension
* Vinstdelningssystem
* Gruppförsäkring
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Bidrag vid föräldraledighet
* Banktjänster
* Banking services
* Benefit in connection with parental leave
* Health promotion subsidy
* Group insurance
* Occupational pension
* Profit-sharing scheme
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

**Din profil**

Vi söker dig som har tidigare praktisk erfarenhet av att bygga och drifta molnbaserade dataplattformar, gärna med fokus på Azure och Databricks. Du har arbetat med modern molninfrastruktur, automation och dataarkitektur och känner dig trygg i både utveckling och drift i en komplex miljö. Du har en universitetsutbildning inom ett tekniskt område och har arbetat med att bygga skalbara och hållbara lösningar som skapar värde för verksamheten. Då vi samarbetar med hela koncernen behöver du goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av:


* Databricks eller liknande moderna lakehouse-/datawarehouse-plattformar
* Azure och Azure DevOps, inklusive CI/CD-miljöer
* SQL och Python inom datahantering
* Molnnätverk, säkerhetskonfigurationer och identitetshantering
* Kunskap om Microsoft Fabric är meriterande

Som person arbetar du tillsammans med ditt team, delar kunskap och tar tillvara på kollegors olika perspektiv för att nå uppsatta mål. Eftersom du kommer samarbeta med många olika målgrupper är det viktigt att du kan anpassa din kommunikation och förmedla lösningsförslag. Du har ett nytänkande förhållningssätt där du inte räds att ta egna beslut, testa nya vägar och omsätta idéer till konkreta förbättringar.


**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

*Som ett steg i Handelsbankens rekryteringsprocess krävs en godkänd bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat, utförd av en extern part, innan anställning kan ske.*

**Kontaktuppgifter**

**Rekryterande chef:** Mikael Wallblom, mikael.wallblom@handelsbanken.se
  

**TA Partner:** Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se
  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:** Susanne Ahlberg, susanne.ahlberg@handelsbanken.se
  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:** Bjarne Nilsson, bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se


  
**Om företaget**
----------------

Hos oss får du ett stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka din egen och bankens framtida utveckling. Våra olika perspektiv, insikter och innovativa idéer utgör en grund för hur vi tillsammans bygger vidare banken för framtiden. För oss är utveckling allt och när du utvecklas, utvecklas banken.


Vi har ett unikt sätt att bedriva bank som bygger på en stark tilltro och respekt för den enskilda människan. Våra värderingar och starka företagskultur har en avgörande betydelse för vår framgång och guidar oss om hur vi uppnår våra mål, samarbetar och stöttar varandra. Genom stark lokal förankring, ett decentraliserat arbetssätt och ett långsiktigt perspektiv skapar vi hållbara relationer genom livets olika skeenden. Hos oss på Handelsbanken är alla viktiga. Vi kommer från olika platser med olika bakgrund, erfarenhet och utbildning. Tillsammans är vi Handelsbanken.

title: DevOps Engineer Lead (Web3)
description:
**About ENS Labs**
==================

**Ethereum Name Service (ENS)** is a decentralized, permissionless naming system built on the Ethereum blockchain that enables human-readable names (like "myname.eth") to be linked to standard Ethereum addresses and other distributed systems.


As one of the first protocols built on Ethereum, ENS has enabled over 3 million registered .eth names, and over another 20 million ENS names from teams such as Coinbase, Uniswap, and Linea, as well as integrations with hundreds of other apps, wallets, protocols, and browsers in the crypto ecosystem.


ENS Labs has been driving the core development of the ENS protocol since 2018. We created the ENS app, open-source libraries, and core smart contracts. We are on a mission to make crypto-powered experiences as easy and accessible as browsing the web. Join us as we build the next iteration of our protocol, ENSv2, and pioneer a more decentralized, flexible, and scalable ENS for the future.

**Why This Role Matters**
-------------------------

**ENS Labs** is looking for an experienced **DevOps Engineer** to own and operate the infrastructure that makes ENS resolve quickly and reliably across chains. You’ll run the metadata service, CCIP-Read gateways, multichain indexers, and emerging Namechain/L2 nodes. Work spans infra management, automation/CI/CD, observability, security/keys, and incident response in a small, remote team.


We’re **a remote-first, mission-driven** team fundamentally committed to **open-source, decentralization, and public goods.**

**What You’ll Do**
------------------

* **Infrastructure management**


	+ Plan, implement, and maintain cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP), including Kubernetes cluster management, container orchestration, networking/security, performance optimization, and scaling.
* **Automation & CI/CD**


	+ **CI/CD:** Own GitHub Actions pipelines for core services; create/maintain Infrastructure as Code; automate builds/tests/deploys, release/versioning, and security scans.
	+ **End-to-end testing:** Own Docker/Compose-based E2E environments integrated with CI; seed realistic data and gate releases on failures.
* **Core ENS services**


	+ **Metadata service:** Operate and harden metadata.ens.domains(HA, caching, secrets, rollouts, SLOs).
	+ **CCIP-Read gateways:** Deploy/scale gateways, manage signing keys/rotation, monitor off-chain lookups/latency, uphold SLAs.
	+ **Indexing:** Run ENSIndexer across L1/L2 with private RPCs; manage Postgres (tuning, backups, schema changes); keep indexing lag low.
	+ **Namechain/L2:** Stand up and maintain L2 nodes; plan upgrades, snapshots, and monitoring; coordinate with external providers (RPC, provers).
* **Reliability, security, and collaboration**


	+ Instrument on-chain/service metrics; build alerts/dashboards; lead incident response and post-mortems.
	+ Enforce least-privilege access, secret hygiene, and key custody for gateways and infra.
	+ Partner with protocol/app engineers; maintain runbooks and concise architecture docs

**Who You Are**
---------------

* 5+ years in DevOps/SRE/Infra running production systems (Kubernetes/containers) on AWS and/or GCP
* Strong CI/CD with GitHub Actions; hands-on with IaC (Terraform/Pulumi/Ansible)
* Automation in TypeScript/Node, Python, or Go
* Observability you’ve shipped: metrics, logs, alerts, dashboards (Prometheus/Grafana + centralized logging)
* Postgres basics (migrations, performance, backups) and Redis caching
* Security-first operator: Familiar with industry standards and best practices; able to serve as front-line triage for production/security issues and escalate when appropriate.
* Familiar with Ethereum/L2 concepts and operating nodes/RPC-driven services
* Clear communicator who documents well and thrives in a remote, async environment.

**Its a Plus If You Have**
--------------------------

* Shipped or contributed to ENS, CCIP-Read gateways, ENSNode/ENSIndexer, or Ponder-style indexers
* Hands-on with zkEVM/rollups (Linea, Scroll, zkSync), prover/verification infra, or cross-chain messaging
* Experience hosting/operating provers or managing relationships with node/prover providers
* Familiarity with trust-minimized gateways and key/cert rotation patterns
* Meaningful open-source contributions showcasing operational depth


ENS Labs is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive, supportive environment for all team members. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and experiences.

title: Data Engineers till enheten Applikationsplattformar
description:
**Gör skillnad med data – vi söker dig som brinner för att förbättra beslutstöd och sjukvård!**


Vill du använda din passion för data och analys för att göra verklig skillnad? Hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i arbetet med att skapa framtidens sjukvård och regionens beslutstöd med hjälp av data. Vi söker Data Engineers som vill bidra till innovativa lösningar och hjälpa bland annat sjukvården att bli ännu bättre för patienter och vårdpersonal. Vi bygger nu en regional dataplattform som förser regionledningen, forskare och samtliga offentliga sjukhus i Stockholm med data och beslutsstöd. Vi ser en unik chans att göra stor nytta för hela Region Stockholm.

**Om tjänsten**
===============


Vi befinner oss i en spännande utvecklingsfas och utökar nu vårt BI-team. Därför söker vi flera nya kollegor som vill vara med och bidra till framtidens vård- och IT-lösningar i Region Stockholm.


Vårt mål är att skapa innovativa lösningar som förbättrar förutsättningarna för vården och möjliggör ett flerdimensionellt beslutstöd. För att stärka vårt arbete utökar vi nu vårt BI-team och söker Data Engineers som vill vara med och bygga och vidareutveckla dataplattformar som verkligen gör skillnad.


Som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att designa, utveckla och optimera plattformar för datainsamling och analys, med fokus på Region Stockholms och sjukvårdens behov. Du kommer också att säkerställa att våra plattformar uppfyller de högsta kraven på säkerhet och integritet, särskilt när det gäller hanteringen av känslig patientdata.


I vårt arbete använder vi bland annat teknologier som

* Transforms med Python och SQLMesh
* Docker och Kubernetes
* Devops med Github actions och ArgoCD

**Vem är du?**
==============


Vi söker dig som är trygg och tydlig i din yrkesroll, du är utvecklare och har jobbat med informationsmodellering, datastrukturer och datalager. Du också en god kommunikatör som kan hantera många kontaktytor samt ha god förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i grupp. Du är proaktiv och har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt och dokumenterar det du utvecklar så att både tekniker och icke-tekniska intressenter kan ta del. Du är strukturerad, analytisk och kan skifta fokus mellan helhet och detaljer. Vi ser även positivt på att du kan bidra med erfarenhet av Scrum Master eller Product Owner rollen för backlog hantering och prioriteringar för att leverera värdeskapande sprintar. Du är nyfiken och vill utvecklas och lära dig mer.


Krav

* Akademisk examen inom ett relevant område (exempelvis datavetenskap, informationsmodellering, systemvetenskap eller liknande)
* Minst 2-3 års erfarenhet av liknande roll samt gedigna kunskaper i SQL och Python
* En passion och driv att använda data och analytics för att göra konkret skillnad inom sjukvården
* Förmåga att kommunicera väl med team, beställare och intressenter
* Prestigelös inställning och ett starkt driv att ständigt vilja lära dig mer
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift – du kan uttrycka dig klart, enkelt och professionellt


Meriterande

* Erfarenhet som scrum master eller product owner
* Erfarenhet av SQLMesh
* Tidigare arbete inom eller i nära samarbete med offentlig sektor


Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper vid tillsättning av denna tjänst.

**Vårt erbjudande**
===================


Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsplats där din insats påverkar direkt och du har möjlighet att växa och utvecklas i en miljö där ditt arbete gör skillnad. Du kommer ingå i ett inkluderande och stödjande team med flera duktiga och pedagogiska Integrations Specialister, en Teamlead och en Tjänsteleveransansvarig.


Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdstimme och friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån har vi för att underlätta för dig att få ihop vardagen. Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.

**Ansökan**
===========


Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.


Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta:

**Linda Branäng,** *Enhetschef Applikationsplattformar,* *Administrativ IT*, E-post: linda.branang@regionstockholm.se


Interjuver sker löpande. Ansök nu och var med på resan mot en datadriven sjukvård i världsklass!

**Övrigt**
----------


Bakgrundskontroller kan komma att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas.

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

  

Det här är en arbetsplats för dig som gillar att ge service och vill att din insats ska göra skillnad. Vi på serviceförvaltningen ska underlätta vardagen för våra kollegor i Region Stockholms kärnverksamheter så att de kan fokusera på patienter, resenärer, invånare och besökare. Vi är 700 personer som arbetar med inköp och upphandling, löne- och personaladministration, ekonomi- och redovisningsadministration, it och medicinsk teknik, användarstöd, lokalservice med mera. Varmt välkommen till en arbetsplats där du blir en del av något större! Läs mer här  




Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* 3–7 års erfarenhet som DevOps-konsult
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av bygg- och leveransprocesser
* Erfarenhet av automatisering av bygg- och leveransflöden
* Goda kunskaper inom Linux & Java
* Erfarenhet av byggmiljöer och build-system (t.ex. Maven/Gradle eller motsvarande)
* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila team
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Svenska och Engelska

  

  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 19-12-2025 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Data Platform Engineer
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**


We’re looking for a hands-on Data Platform Engineer engineer who thrives at the intersection of streaming data, scalable ETL, and robust infrastructure. In this role, you’ll architect, build, and optimize real-time ingestion services and PySpark pipelines on Azure Databricks, ensuring low-latency, reliable, and secure data movement from diverse clients and systems. You’ll also own containerized APIs, CI/CD workflows, and IaC for reproducible environments.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**


* Design real-time client integrations for ingestion, including hardware–software wrappers and edge connectivity.
* Build low latency streaming pipelines from clients and services using Event Hubs/Kafka, Databricks Autoloader, and Delta Lake best practices.
* Implement large file handling strategies (chunking, parallel processing), sync jobs, and storage lifecycle management across Azure Storage.
* Solve complex software and data engineering problems, implementing reliable mechanisms, logging, and error-handling logic.
* Configure and leverage Unity Catalog for advanced search, metadata indexing, lineage, and access control.
* Develop and operate Azure Databricks/PySpark ETL pipelines for batch and streaming workloads.
* Orchestrate jobs with Azure Data Factory (ADF), integrating triggers, dependencies, and alerting.
* Containerize and deploy APIs (e.g., FastAPI/Flask) with CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions/Azure DevOps) and robust release strategies.
* Use IaC (ARM/Terraform) for reproducible infrastructure across environments.
* Embed observability (logging, metrics, tracing) and performance tuning for streaming and batch jobs.
* Collaborate with data platform, product, and security teams to meet SLAs and compliance requirements.

**WHAT YOU WILL BRING**


* Proven experience with real-time client ingestion and hardware–software wrapper design.
* Hands-on expertise in low-latency streaming using Event Hubs/Kafka and Databricks Autoloader.
* Strong skills in large file processing, parallelization, synchronization, and storage management in Azure (Blob/Data Lake).
* Solid software engineering fundamentals: structured logging, retry/backoff, circuit breakers, idempotency, and stateful/stateless designs.
* Practical experience with Unity Catalog (advanced search, metadata indexing, data lineage, policies).
* Containerization & CI/CD experience (Docker, GitHub Actions/Azure DevOps), deploying APIs to Azure services (AKS, App Service, Container Apps).
* Working knowledge of IaC: Terraform and/or ARM templates for environment provisioning.

**WHO ARE WE?**


We love doing things together and strive for a good balance between work and leisure. This could be after-work hangouts, events, sports activities, ski trips, or inspirational talks. We've been on many fun trips together, which have been fantastic, and something we want to continue doing.


Skills development has always been important to us, and in addition to growth opportunities within your consulting assignments and various technical trainings, we also have internal programs for personal development.

**WE ARE PART OF THE SIGMA GROUP**


As part of the Sigma Group, we offer the best of both worlds: stability and entrepreneurial spirit. Sigma consists of several companies within different technical competence areas and currently has over 5,000 employees and operations in many countries. This makes us Sweden’s largest privately-owned consulting group.

title: Senior Talent Sourcer
description:
**About Proxify**


Founded in 2018 and headquartered in Stockholm, Proxify helps 2500+ companies globally to scale their tech teams with top-tier talent in Software, Data, and AI. When internal demand for tech skills arises, Proxify delivers tailored, vetted developers —often within 48 hours— removing traditional hiring bottlenecks and enabling companies to scale faster and smarter.


In 2025, Proxify was highlighted by the Financial Times as the third fastest growing company in Sweden, and took a spot in the Deloitte Fast 50 Sweden in 2024. We have successfully delivered over 700 tech placements to startups, scale-ups, and global enterprises, including names such as Securitas, Electrolux, and Lufthansa.

**About the role**


We are looking for a high-impact Senior Talent Sourcer who excels in discovering, engaging, and converting top-tier tech talent.


Your **primary mission (#1)** will be **proactive talent sourcing** at scale.


Your **secondary mission (#2)** will be **candidate engagement**, which may include screening, candidate advisory, expectation management, and pipeline stewardship — depending on evolving needs.


You’ll play a strategic role in building our talent supply engine while continuously refining sourcing methodologies to maximize quality and speed.

**What you will do**

**Core Responsibilities**

* Source 30–40 qualified tech candidates per day (mainly from LinkedIn)
* Build and maintain talent pools for roles such as Full-stack, Backend, Frontend, DevOps, Data, QA, ML/AI, and Security
* Develop advanced sourcing strategies (Boolean, X-ray, market mapping)
* Maintain structured talent pipelines and monitor key sourcing metrics

**Candidate Engagement & Collaboration**

* Conduct structured screening to assess motivation, communication and fit
* Act as a point of contact for candidates throughout the process
* Provide concise candidate assessments and recommendations
* Partner with Recruiters, Client Manager to ensure alignment and quality
* Represent Proxify professionally during all candidate interactions

**Why you’ll love this opportunity at Proxify:**


️ Be part of a humble, supportive and tech-savvy team


Great opportunities for professional development and personal growth


Be part of a global team across 39+ countries


High ownership, high impact: your decisions move the needle

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:**

**What you must have (Required)**

* 5+ years of sourcing experience in IT / tech recruitment
* Strong experience in candidate screening & assessment
* Proven ability to source from LinkedIn & open-web channels
* Solid understanding of tech roles (Frontend, Backend, DevOps, Data, etc.)
* Strong command of Boolean / X-ray search
* Excellent communication & stakeholder collaboration
* Fluent English (C1+ level)
* Structured, autonomous, and comfortable working with KPIs

**What is nice to have (Preferred)**

* Experience sourcing for European & global markets
* Familiarity with tools like HireEZ, AmazingHiring, or similar
* Prior experience in a scale-up or high-volume hiring environment
* Experience working with engineers or technical communities
* Basic technical literacy (ability to understand tech concepts and frameworks)

**At Proxify, we believe that great hiring shapes the future.**


With the right people, anything is possible. Are you one of them?


We look forward to meeting you


Please submit your application / CV in English.

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description:
**About TOTEME**


TOTEME is a fashion house rooted in Swedish sensibilities, modern aspirations and the notion of style. With an appreciation for women’s many roles and how pieces are worn in practice, we create emblematic designs with an emphasis on materiality and shape. Representing a direct and decisive way of dressing, the collections are contextualized in curated edits, visuals and spaces. The company is rooted in values that promote the wellbeing of people, animals, and the planet.  

  

TOTEME was founded in 2014 by Elin Kling and Karl Lindman. From the atelier in Stockholm, we create collections spanning ready-to-wear, shoes, bags, accessories and jewelry.


**The role**  

  

TOTEME is looking for a full-time Quality Assurance Analyst to join our Stockholm team. You will ensure the quality and usability of our core business systems through test coordination, stakeholder collaboration, and hands-on testing across platforms such as our OMS, ecommerce site, ERP, POS, and internal tools. You’ll also support teams in their daily system use, contribute to scoping and planning, occasionally coordinate smaller tech projects, and help drive user adoption through training. The role reports to the Head of Technology.

**Responsibilities**

* Perform hands-on testing for new technology initiatives and existing tools, including test planning, writing test cases, and conducting manual testing across integrations.
* Act as the QA point of contact in cross-functional projects. Coordinate testing activities with tech and business stakeholders.
* Champion best practices in QA and contribute to building a strong testing culture within the tech team.
* Support end users with system-related questions and issues to improve daily workflows.
* Deliver training and onboarding sessions for new tools, features, and systems.
* Support agile ways of working by helping with early scoping, requirement clarification, and coordination of smaller tech initiatives.
* Maintain clear and up-to-date documentation, such as guides, process flows, and training materials.
* Continuously assess and improve QA processes to ensure scalable and efficient testing.
* Explore opportunities for test automation together with developers and tech leads.
* Participate in and contribute to TOTEME’s social and environmental sustainability strategy.

**Your profile**

* Experience in quality assurance, software testing, or technical support, with a solid understanding of QA methodologies.
* Comfortable working hands-on with testing across multiple systems (e.g., OMS, POS, ecommerce platforms).
* Comfortable supporting business users and facilitating user testing and training.
* Familiar with tools like Azure DevOps and interested in developing test automation and improving processes.
* Experience in retail, fashion, or ecommerce tech is an advantage.
* Fluent in spoken and written English.

**About you**

* A collaborative team player with a proactive, service-minded approach.
* Curious and eager to grow, you enjoy understanding how systems work and finding ways to improve them.
* Comfortable taking initiative and acting as a go-to person for both technical and non-technical teams.
* Confident working independently, while also knowing when to ask questions or raise blockers.
* Analytical, structured, and focused on continuous improvement.
* A clear and effective communicator.


This is a full-time position based at TOTEME's Head Office in Stockholm, starting as soon as possible.
  

  

TOTEME has teams in Stockholm, London, New York, and Shanghai, as well as retail spaces across Europe, North America, and Asia. As a member of our dynamic, creative, and highly collaborative team, you will take part in exciting projects and milestones, evolving within your role as you contribute to the company’s growth.

  

TOTEME stands for inclusivity and a sense of belonging in the workplace. We welcome all applicants and recruit on the basis of skills and experience.

*By applying to this position I agree with TOTEME’s privacy policy and to be contacted about future job opportunities for up to 2 years from the submission date. Find out more about our privacy policy* *here**.*

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* Hands-on experience in building a DevOps environment.
* Expert level experience with setting up and managing on-prem Kubernetes infrastructure (e.g. vSphere Kubernetes Service)
* Good knowledge in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools like Jenkins and similar tools.
* A good understanding of the chain of activities involved developing an application: Application prototyping, IDE, Source Code Control (Repository), Code Analysis, Code Review and Commit, Continuous Integration and Delivery, Build Automation, Build Artifact, Deploy, Quality Assurance.
* Server orchestration knowledge.
* Expert level Linux knowledge required.

  

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 09-12-2025  


  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

title: Data Scientist
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* You have 5+ years of experience in a similar role as a Data Scientist and are proficient in analyzing complex data using SQL (Google BigQuery), Python, or R.
* You have a track record of collaborating with engineers in the product development process, helping them shape projects and translate open-ended questions into concrete analysis plans.
* You possess strong foundational knowledge with practical experience in designing and analyzing A/B tests.
* You are well-versed in various analysis techniques, such as linear and logistic regression, significance testing, and statistical modeling.
* You are proficient in creating insightful dashboards using Tableau, Looker Studio or other BI tools.

title: Fullstack .NET/React
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* God kunskap inom utveckling med hjälp av .Net och C#
* God förståelse för och kan utveckla gränssnitt/frontend med React
* God kunskap om databaser, SQL och SQL Server
* God kunskap om Power BI och datalager
* God kunskap om GIt och kan arbeta med versionshantering av källkod

  

**Meriterande**  

* God kunskap MS Azure DevOps

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 05-12-2025 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Infrastrukturarkitekter till Knowit FLX Stockholm!
description:
**Infrastrukturarkitekter till Knowit Solutions FLX Stockholm**


Vi söker dig som vill forma framtidens plattformar inom cloud, onprem eller en kombination. Du arbetar med att designa och utveckla stabil och säker infrastruktur och stöttar både teknikval och strategier. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med utvecklingsteam, drift, säkerhet och verksamhet.


Knowit har ett stort antal kunder inom såväl privat som offentlig sektor. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och forma framtidens plattformar – oavsett om din huvudfokus är Cloud, on-prem eller en hybrid däremellan.


Rollen kan omfatta allt från molnplattformar till traditionell infrastruktur – beroende på din bakgrund och inriktning.

**Exempel på uppgifter**

* Design av miljöer i cloud, onprem och hybrider
* Lösningar inom compute, storage, nätverk, backup och övervakning
* Stöd i roadmap och plattformsstrategi
* Bidra i moderniseringsinitiativ
* Rådgivning kring säkerhet och prestanda
* Framtagning av arkitekturdokumentation
* Samverkan med drift, DevOps och säkerhet

**Erfarenhet**


Du behöver inte kunna allt men vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av några av följande. Azure, AWS, GCP, containerplattformar, Windows Server, Linux, VMware, nätverk, lagring, backup, PowerShell, Bash, IaC som Terraform eller Bicep, CI CD samt identitets och åtkomsthantering med Entra ID, SSO, MFA och Zero Trust.

**Varför Knowit Solutions FLX**


Hos oss väljer du själv lön, pension, uppdrag och arbetstid. Du ingår i ett mindre bolag med snabba beslut men får samtidigt styrkan av en stor koncern. Vi erbjuder många kunduppdrag inom både offentlig och privat sektor och ett starkt nätverk av erfarna kollegor. Hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetent nätverk av kollegor, får stöd av en stark säljorganisation som matchar dig med rätt uppdrag och har styrkan hos ett av Nordens största IT-konsultbolag i ryggen.


Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Azure arkitekter till Knowit Solutions FLX Stockholm
description:
**Vad vi söker**


Vill du vara med och skapa moderna, skalbara och säkra lösningar i Microsoft Azure? Vi söker Azure-arkitekter med olika inriktningar – från infrastruktur och säkerhet till integration, DevOps och data.


Knowit har ett stort antal kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor. Vi söker dig som vill bidra till att utveckla framtidens Azure plattformar oavsett om det gäller hela miljöer eller enskilda delar.

  

Vi arbetar med komplexa miljöer där identitet, säkerhet och automation är viktiga områden. Därför är erfarenhet av IAM i Azure/Entra ID meriterande, men inte ett krav.

**Exempel på uppgifter**

  

* Design och arkitektur av molnbaserade lösningar i Azure
* Modernisering av befintliga plattformar och applikationer
* Säkerhetsdesign utifrån Zero Trust och best practices
* Integrationer, API-design och plattformsarkitektur
* Infrastruktur i Azure (compute, storage, nätverk) och hybridlösningar
* Delta i arkitekturforum, tekniska roadmap-arbeten och rådgivning
* Stöd till utvecklingsteam och drift i tekniska beslut
* Dokumentation, principer och best practices

**Erfarenhet**  

Du behöver inte kunna allt men vi ser gärna erfarenhet av några av följande. Azure tjänster inom compute, nätverk, lagring och databaser, IaC via Bicep eller Terraform, IAM, identitet via Entra ID, grunder i nätverk samt modeller för säker och stabil drift.

**Varför Knowit Solutions FLX**  

Hos oss väljer du själv lön, pension, uppdrag och arbetstid. Du ingår i ett mindre bolag med snabba beslut men får samtidigt styrkan av en stor koncern. Vi erbjuder många kunduppdrag inom både offentlig och privat sektor och ett starkt nätverk av erfarna kollegor. Hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetent nätverk av kollegor, får stöd av en stark säljorganisation som matchar dig med rätt uppdrag och har styrkan hos ett av Nordens största IT konsultbolag i ryggen.


Välkommen med din ansökan

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
***Välkommen till MRC Bemanning– bemanning och konsultlösningar för framtiden***


Vi är ett bemannings- och konsultföretag som arbetar brett över flera branscher. Vår drivkraft är att matcha rätt kompetens med rätt uppdrag, oavsett om det handlar om teknik, administration, ekonomi, logistik eller andra områden.

***Vad vi gör***


Vi hjälper företag och organisationer att hitta den kompetens de behöver för att växa – samtidigt som vi erbjuder våra konsulter spännande uppdrag som utvecklar både karriären och individen. Hos oss kan du arbeta i olika roller och branscher, allt beroende på din erfarenhet och vad du själv vill satsa på framåt.

***Vår kultur***


Hos oss är du aldrig ”bara” en konsult. Du blir en del av ett nätverk där vi stöttar varandra, utvecklas tillsammans och där din personliga resa är minst lika viktig som din yrkesroll. Vi tror på öppenhet, gemenskap och att bygga långsiktiga relationer – både med kunder och medarbetare.

***Varför välja oss?***

* Trygga anställningar med kollektivavtal
* Uppdrag i flera olika branscher – du väljer vägen framåt
* Möjlighet till kompetensutveckling och nya karriärvägar
* Ett personligt bemötande – vi ser dig och dina mål

  

Vi på **MRC Bemanning** letar efter passionerade IT-konsulter som vill vara med och göra skillnad – både för våra kunder och för varandra.

***Kvalifikationer***

* Design och underhåll av CI/CD-pipelines
* Automatisering av utvecklings- och testflöden
* Optimering av molninfrastruktur (AWS, Azure eller GCP)
* Täta samarbeten med utvecklingsteam för smidiga release-processer
* Övervakning av systemprestanda och tillgänglighet
* Säkerhetsimplementering enligt best practice

***Du är:***

* Lösningsorienterad och systematisk
* Van vid att jobba självständigt och i team
* Intresserad av ny teknik och processförbättring
* Ansvarstagande, nyfiken och driven

***Arbetsuppgifter***

* Några års erfarenhet av DevOps eller relaterade roller
* Flytande svenska (C1–C2) samt god engelska i tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i CI/CD-verktyg (ex. GitLab CI, Jenkins, CircleCI)
* Erfarenhet av Docker och Kubernetes
* Van att arbeta med molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller GCP
* Kompetens inom Bash, Python eller motsvarande scriptspråk
* Erfarenhet av loggning/monitorering (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK-stack)
* Relevant akademisk examen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet

 ***Vad du får hos oss***

* Spännande och varierande uppdrag hos intressanta kunder
* En arbetsplats med högt i tak, öppen kommunikation och härliga kollegor
* Lön som speglar din erfarenhet

  

Har du frågor? Hör av dig till **Fredrik Steveling** på mail, **fredrik.steveling@mrcbemanning.se** – vi berättar gärna mer om rollen och oss som arbetsgivare.

description:
